Mrs. Santos is 57 years old and lives at 112 Manuel Cox in Aurora Diaz, in the district of Salaverry in the province of Trujillo in the suburb of La Libertad, Perú. She belongs to the Auroras in action community bank. Santos studied until the second year of elementary school, which equates to third grade, because her mother was poor, she did not have a father and had to work since she was very young. She married, but 7 years ago was widowed. She has 5 children, 4 work and only 1 depends on her now because he is still a student. She began her business by selling food. She later sold gas and now also sells beer. She is thankful for the Manuel Ramos movement because thanks to it she could obtain loans easily. Santos operates her business out of her house, and now counts on a partner. Her first loan was 300 soles and she returned itin 4 months. With this loan she expanded her business and purchased gas which she later sold. With the current loan of 1,000 soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she plans on investing in beer. Santos dreams of watching her youngest son become a professional, as her other children could not become professionals for economic reasons.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beer to sell

loans.name: Silvia Eugenia

texts.es: La Señorita Silvia P. C., solicita este crédito para aumentar su capital de trabajo, ella es relativamente nueva en el negocio, ya que tiempo atrás ayudaba a su mamá en otro negocio, actualmente ella se independizó y tiene su propio negocio de venta de frutas en un mercado de la ciudad de La Paz, Bolivia, por ser muy responsable, se acepta la solicitúd de crédito al demostrar su aptitúd emprendedora. Silvia Eugenia además de ocuparse de la venta de fruta; estudia por las tardes en un Instituto de formación profesional.
texts.en:
Silvia P. C. is seeking a loan to increase her working capital. Her business is relatively new since she used to help her mother operate another business. She is now independent and has her own fruit sales business in a market in La Paz, Bolivia. Her loan request has been accepted due to her demonstration of responsibility and an enterprising attitude. Silvia Eugenia, apart from her work in fruit sales, studies in the afternoons in a professional institute.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Maria Auxiliadora tiene 41 años de edad, habita en el barrio Casimiro Sotelo de la ciudad de Managua, es casada, tiene 3 hijos de 18, 15 y 14 años de edad, quienes se encuentran estudiando. Maria Auxiliadora es docente de educación secundaria, también vende cosméticos de manera ambulante y tiene una guardería en su vivienda. Tiene 15 años de experiencia en la docencia y 4 años de vender comséticos. El negocio lo inició con ahorros que tenía ya que el salario como maestra era bajo. El destino del préstamo será usado en la compra de más cosméticos, porque desea incrementar el volumen de ventas. En un futuro desea poder ampliar el espacio de su casa en donde tiene la guardería
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora is 41 years old, lives in the Casimiro Sotelo neighborhood of Managua. She is married and has 3 children of 18, 15, and 14 years of age, who are currently in school. Maria is a teacher of secondary education and also sells cosmetics on foot and has a day-care in her home. She has been teaching for 15 years and selling cosmetics for 4 years. She started the business with savings she had, since her salary as a teacher was very low. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase more cosmetics, because she would like to increase sales volume. In the future she hopes to be able to add on to her home where she has the day-care.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To Purchase cosmetics (to sell)

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 59 años, ella y su esposo tuvieron 9 hijos, de los cuales ahora solo 2 están con ellos y estudian en el colegio de su pueblo.  Rosita es una madre muy activa, en horas de la mañana prepara desayuno y a la vez cocina el almuerzo, después tiene que salir a comprar plátano o sacarlo de su propio huerto, luego procede a colocarlos en sus cajones, para llevarlos a un mercado de la ciudad. Su esposo se dedica a sembrar café, maíz, yuca, fréjoles y plátano. Cuando es temporada de siembra, apoya a su esposo. Lo que más le gusta es ganar lo adecuado según su trabajo, lo dificultoso es el precio del transporte de sus cajones de plátano, que es muy alto y tiene que recuperarlo en la venta de la fruta.  Ella y su esposo tienen que trabajar en sus actividades porque sino no les alcanza para el menú diario y para los gastos de sus hijos menores que aun les falta estudiar, y como padres quieren darles lo mejor.  El préstamo que ha solicitado será invertido en cajones y la otra parte en la compra de plátanos en mayor cantidad. Además dedicarse a sembrar ella misma, para no tener que comprar a otras personas.
texts.en:
Rosa is 59 years old. She and her husband have 9 children, of whom only 2 now live with them and study in the high school in their town. Rosita is a very active mother. In the morning, she makes breakfast and, at the same time, she cooks lunch. Later, she has to go to buy bananas or take them from her own garden. Then she puts them in boxes to take them to a market in the city. Her husband sows coffee, corn, yucca, beans, and bananas. When is the sowing season, she helps her husband. What she likes most is to earn a sufficient amount after her work. The difficult thing is the price of transportation for the boxes of bananas, which is very high. She has to recover that when she sells the fruit. She and her husband have to work because otherwise they won’t have enough to pursue their daily activities and for the expenses for their young children, who are still studying. As their parents, they have to give them the best. This loan will be invested into boxes and the purchase of more bananas. In addition, she will sow herself, so that they don’t have to hire other people.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell and boxes for transport

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo de 52 años, un padre muy responsable, mas aún, cuando la madre de sus hijos los abandonó, desde entonces  su mayor anhelo es darles una buena educación a ellos.   En horas de la mañana, todos días prepara los alimentos de sus hijos, y luego se va a trabajar  a su chacra hasta horas de la noche.  Desde muy niño se dedicó al campo, le gusta la actividad que realiza, pero lo que le falta son herramientas adecuadas para sus cultivos, aun así ha sembrado maíz con dificultades.   Alfredo se desvela por la educación de sus hijos desde hace tres años, ellos son el motivo de su trabajo y esfuerzo.  Desea adquirir herramientas de trabajo para la chacra, que le permitan limpiar de su chacra, de ese modo agrandar sus tierras para ser mejor aprovechadas.
texts.en:
Alfredo, 52, is an exceptionally responsible father. When the mother of his children abandoned them, he decided that he would provide the children with the best possible education. In the early hours of each day, he fixes meals for the children and then sets out to work his land, working until nightfall. He's been farming since he was a small boy, work that he likes. He needs better tools to cultivate his land, though, because he can only plant maize now with difficulty. Alfredo worries day and night about his children's education; they're the reason for his sweat and toil. He wants to buy work tools for the farm so that he can clear it. By clearing it, he can expand his land and better provide for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tools for farming business.

loans.name: La Roca Group

texts.es:
Hola nosotras somos el grupo LA ROCA, nos dedicamos al comercio, juntas hemos trabajado por varios años como grupo, somos mujeres luchadoras y tambien somos vecinas de nuestra colonia, nuestro grupo se integra de esta forma:
Nitida A.: me dedico a la fabricacion de Nacatamales de pollo y cerdo, tengo varios años de vender este tipo de comida, que en nuestro pais la gente come mucho los nacatamales, 
Sara P.: ella se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, ella tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion en la cual le va muy bien, pero necesita tener mas productos en su negocio porque las necesidades de sus clientes son enormes. 
Magda G.: ella se dedica a la venta de condimentos, este negocio es muy bueno porque en nuestro pais todas las amas de casa y la gente de produce comidas utilizan mucho los condimentos que es lo que le da el sabor a las comidas.
en estos momentos todas nosotras necesitamos un credito para sacar adelante nuestros negocios por tal razon estamos solicitando dicho credito.
texts.en:
Hello, we are the group "The Rock", and we work in sales. As a group, we have worked together for many years. We are fighting women and neighbors in our village. Our group works like this: Nitida A., I make chicken and pork Nacatamales, and I have been selling this kind of food for many years. The people of our country eat Nacatamales all the time! Sara P., She sells popular consumption goods. She has a store in her home that is doing very well, but she needs more products in her business because the needs of her clients are enormous. Magda G.: she sells condiments. This is a ery good business because in our county all the women of the home and people that produce food to sell use a lot of condiments to give flavor to their food. At this time all of us need loans to be able to move ahead with our business, which is why we are requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goods to supply a store, Purchase of supplies to make Nacatamales and condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of cattle feed.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La sra. Julia, ella se dedica desde hace mucho tiempo a la compra y venta de ropa y productos varios, los comercializa en las ferias de las ciudades de Uyuni y Oruro en el interior de la república de Bolivia, vive en la casa de su mamá junto a su hermano, quien siempre la apoya,  la sra. hace el papel de padre y madre para sus hijos quienes están en edad escolar, ya que es madre soltera, quienes le ayudan  en todo lo que pueden. Es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora. El crédito será invertido en la compra de chompas ya que se inicia el periodo de lluvias.
texts.en:
Ms. Julia has been buying and selling clothing and various products for a long time. She sells her goods in the open market fairs in the cities of Uyuni and Oruro in the middle of the Bolivian Republic. She live in her mother's home with her brother, who is always supportive of her. Julia plays the role of mother and father for her children who are school-aged. She is a single mother who helps her children in every way she can. She is a very hard-working and responsible person. The loan will be invested in the purchase of raincoats since the rainy season has begun.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of jackets (raincoats)

loans.name: David Hernán

texts.es: David tiene 32 años de edad, habita en el barrio Hialeah, es casado tiene tres hijos. David tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación y también un sala de video ubicada también en su vivienda. Tiene 2 años de tener la pulpería y debido a la falta de financiamiento se le ha hecho difícil poder crecer. Inició solamente con la sala de video juegos, y gracias a unos ahorros puso la pulpería. El préstamo será usado para comprar un play satation para la sala de video juegos y granos básicos para la pulpería, y así de poquito a poquito invertir en ambos negocios. Sus planes son poder incrementar el inventario de su pulpería para así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
David is 32 years old. He lives in the Hialeah neighborhood, is married and has three children. David has a small convenience store in his house as well as a video game store. He has had the convenience store for 2 years but for lack of financing it has difficult for him to grow. He started out with only the video game store and thanks to some savings, put in the convenience store. This loan will be used to buy a playstation for the video game store and some staple goods for the convenience store; in this way he will invest a little in both businesses. He plans are to be able to increase the convenience store´s inventory so he can meet the needs of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a playstation and staple goods

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel tiene 38 años, él y su esposa tienen tres hijos, todos ellos son oriundos de la zona llamada Nagazu.   Durante toda su vida se dedicó al cultivo de sus tierras, siembra café, plátano y también en esta temporada ha sembrado caigua, él creció con las actividades de la chacra, porque su padre fue agricultor, conoce cómo y cuándo tiene que ir cultivando a cada producto.  Le agrada  mucho el cuidado de cada planta, porque cada proceso es diferente, pero siente una gran incomodidad por los precios del guano de isla y demás fertilizantes por que invierte mucho y gana muy poco. Pero sus sueños están en la agricultura, con el tiempo le gustaría tener una casa de material noble y no de maderas, como ahora.  El y su esposa se esfuerzan para adquirir su propia casa, y tener qué heredarles a sus hijos, asimismo darles una buena educación, que ellos no pudieron tener.  Con el dinero abonará su chacra de caigua para la floración y de ese modo agarre fruto, también sembrará mas pacay en su huerto. Si cumple con todo el abonado y el fumigado de la caigua y se desarrolla bien y esto le permitirá cosechar en gran cantidad para el verano y tener un buen precio.
texts.en:
Daniel is 38 years old, he and his wife have three children, all of them born in the Nagazu area. His entire life has been devoted to cultivating his fields. He plants coffee, bananas and also during this season he plants caigua (a vine which grows a small gourd-shaped fruit, used as a vegetable). He grew up with farming activities because his father was a farmer, and he knows how and when to grow each product. He likes taking care of the plants because the process for each is different. He is concerned about the price of guano (manure from sea birds) and other fertilizers because he invests a lot and earns very little. But his dreams are based on farming. In time he would like to have a house made of solid material, not of wood as he now has. He and his wife are trying to buy their own house so they have something to leave as an inheritance to their children as well as giving them a good education, something which neither were able to have. With a loan he will fertilize his caigua fields so they blossom and bear fruit. He will also plant more pacay (a Peruvian leguminous tree, cultivated for its large white edible pods) in his orchard. If he is able to finish fertilizing and fumigating the caigua and everything goes well, he will be able to harvest a large amount this summer and get a good price.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in organic and chemical fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis, a sus 22 años, es un padre de una hermosa niña, el y su esposa se dedican a veces a la compra y venta de ropa y en otras veces a la agricultura.  Realiza diversas  actividades, para generarse ingresos económicos adicionales a los de su chacra, en temporada de siembra cultiva café, plátano, etc., esta vez ha sembrado caigua, con la finalidad de cosechar en temporada de verano, donde tendrá buen precio. Y a veces aprovecha de llevar algunas prendas para vender a las personas cercanas a sus tierras. 
La dificultad ahora, son los precios de los abonos, pero a pesar de todo le gusta sembrar, cultivar todo tipo de productos, conoce en qué temporadas se debe sembrar para sacar provecho del precio en el mercado.  Luis por el momento vive en la casa de su suegra, por ello es que trabaja con mucho esmero para adquirir su propio hogar, y más adelante adquirir su propia movilidad para que lleve al mercado lo que produce.  El invertirá en siembra de caigua, después de 5 meses recuperará su capital y pueda ganar el doble, en enero cosechará y venderá hasta febrero, temporada de buen predio de este producto.
texts.en:
Luis, at 22 years old, is a father of a beautiful daughter. He and his wife make a living buying and selling clothes at times and by farming at other timers. They take part in various activities to generate extra income for their small household, and during the planting season they cultivate coffee, bananas and other products. Currently Luis has planted a regional vegetable called caigua with the goal of harvesting it when it can fetch a good price. Sometimes he takes some clothes to sell to the people in the areas surrounding his lands. The difficulty now, however, is that the price of fertilizer is high, but he still enjoys planting and harvesting all kinds of products, and he knows what season to plant which product to make the most of it in the market. At the moment Luis lives in the house of his mother-in-law, so he works arduously so he can acquire his own place and later his own vehicle so he can transport his products. With the loan, he will invest in cultivating caigua, and in five months he can double his return. He will harvest it in January and will sell it through February, the ideal time to sell this product.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in cultivating caigua, a regional plant that will fetch good prices at the market.

loans.name: Lola

texts.es: Lola (38 años) tiene dificultades en su economía, ya que ha tenido 8 hijos, de los cuales 6 estudian, ella y su esposo tienen que trabajar donde se les presente la oportunidad de ganar algo de dinero.  Madruga para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos, asimismo tiene que cocinar el almuerzo temprano, para ir a la chacra con su esposo, no solo se dedican a su propia chacra; sino también, trabajan como jornales para los cultivos de otras personas.  Siembran granadillas y café, pero esta vez quieren incursionar en la siembra de caigua, por que demora solo 4 meses en  producir, y les deja una buena ganancia, sobre todo en tiempo de verano, a ella le agrada mucho el negocio, cuando ya no está en la chacra, lleva sus productos a los mercados, mientras tanto, su esposo (en la foto nos muestra una caja de cerveza) se queda en casa vendiendo gaseosas, algunos bocaditos y  cervezas, lo más dificultoso para ellos es la falta de capital, pero igual no pierden las esperanzas de mejorar su casa y poder tener una bodega con el tiempo.  Lola y su esposo trabajan tanto en la chacra o en otra actividad que se presente, con la finalidad de educarlos a sus 6 hijos en etapa escolar.  Con el dinero del préstamo, invertirán en la  siembra de caigua porque justamente saldría para la época del verano, donde su precio es muy bueno.
texts.en:
Lola, who is 38 years old, is having difficult times economically. Six of her eight children are in school, and she and her husband have to work where there are opportunities to make some money. She gets up very early to make breakfast for her kids and also makes lunch before she heads off to her farmland with her husband. She doesn't work exclusively on her own land, but also also works as a day laborer on other people's crops. She cultivates passion fruit and coffee, but this time she also wants to include caigua, a regional plant that will take only four months to produce with high margins, especially in the summer. Lola is very pleased with her business. When she isn't in the fields, she takes her products to the local markets. Meanwhile her husband (holding the box of beer in the photo) stays at home selling soft drinks, sandwiches and beer. The most difficult thing for them is a lack of capital, but they have not lost hope of improving their home and, with time, opening up a bodega. Lola and her husband work so hard on their fields and their other activities with the goal of providing for their six children who are still in school. With the loan, they will invest in the cultivation of caigua because summertime will soon come when their prices will be very good.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her land to cultivate caigua, a regional plant

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es: Lorenzo, a sus 23 años, vive con su abuela de 70 años, siembra en las chacras de ella, para de este modo mantener a la mujer que ha sido como su madre, es soltero y muy trabajador.  Tiene plantas de plátano, demora en crecer un aproximado de 9 meses, una vez que cosecha,  cada 15 días, se vuelve a cosechar. Esta actividad le genera ganancias para poder mantener a su madre enferma, que no vive con él.   Su trabajo cotidiano es la chacra, desde que amanece hasta que cae la noche. Como todo joven, tiene el anhelo de estudiar mecánica, pero el costo no le permite aún poder hacerlo.   Para Lorenzo es muy dura la vida, tiene que trabajar en el cultivo de sus tierras, para mantener a su abuela que ya está muy anciana, y lo más complicado es que tiene a su madre enferma que no puede hablar, y como hijo siente la obligación de apoyarla.  El dinero lo invertirá en la siembra de más hectáreas de plátano, más adelante quiere incursionar en la siembra de café, porque considera que cuantos más productos siembre, tendrá mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 23 years old and lives with his 70-year-old grandmother. He works on her fields and in this way can provide for the woman who has been like a mother to him. He's single and very hard-working. He has crops of bananas, which take about nine months to ripen, and he harvests them every 15 days after that. This activity also helps him make money to provide for his sick mother, who doesn't live with him. He works daily in the fields, from sunrise until evening. Like many young men, his goal is to study mechanics, but he can't afford the costs. Life is very hard for Lorenzo, who works hard to cultivate the land to provide for this grandmother, who is no quite old, and what makes things more complicated is that his sick mother cannot speak, and as her son he feels obligated to support her. With the loan, he will invest in planting more hectares of bananas and later expand to cultivating coffee as well, because he feels that the more products you plant, the more income you can make.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plant more hectares of bananas so he can produce more fruit

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, a sus 24 años tiene un hogar muy constituido, ella y su esposo tratan de trabajar en cualquier actividad para que sus dos hijos no tengan que pasar necesidades.  Desde que se casó trabaja en la chacra, después del medio día, viendo a los operarios y de paso apoya a su esposo, tiene en sus chacras sembradas dos hectáreas de plátanos, que están cosechando, asimismo ahora piensa incursionar en la siembra del café, aunque dice que el café se cosecha una vez al año.  Lo que mas le agrada de su actividad como agricultora es el tiempo de la cosecha, porque llega la oportunidad de llevar al mercado y ganar dinero y es la oportunidad de comprar lo que falta es un hogar. Pero le disgusta que ha veces se queda con su carga en la chacra por falta de movilidad, y además cobran muy caro el transporte, a veces esto lo desanima.  El motivo de su esfuerzo es adquirir cosas de primera necesidad para su hogar, y para su casa de madera, le gustaría renovarla, por una casa de material noble, es su mayor anhelo.  Ella tiene en mente de sembrar el café por primera vez,  este préstamo para ella, dice que es una bendición, de ese modo logrará su objetivo, de aquí a un año, podrá cosechar y negociar su café, de ese modo pueda crecer como familia.
texts.en:
Ana, 24, runs a model home. She and her husband try working at whatever they can find to make sure that their two children don't have to go without the things they need. Since her marriage, Ana has worked on the farm in the afternoons, overseeing the workers and helping her husband. She has two hectares of plantains that are being harvested and she's now thinking of jumping in to coffee growing though she says that coffee can only be harvested once a year. The thing she most likes about being a farmer is the harvest because it's the time of year when she can go to market, sell her crop and buy the things she needs at home. She hasn't liked having to remain behind at times because of a lack of transport, something that's very expensive. The motive for her efforts is buying the basic goods that she needs at home. Her greatest goal is to rebuild her wooden house with a better material. Her idea is to plant coffee for the first time. She says that this loan is a blessing for her, a way to fulfill her goal of being able to harvest and sell her coffee and, ultimately, help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plant a coffee crop for the first time.

loans.name: Alyeris Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Alyeris habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Hialeah III etapa, tiene 24 años de edad, soltera, actualmente estudiante de la universidad, la carrera de Administración de Empresa, lo cual son muchos gastos, pues sus padres le ayudaron para que tuviera un negocio propio donde pudiera ayudarse con sus gastos, pues comenzó vendiendo cosméticos   a sus compañeras de colegio y ha logrado tener muchos clientes, ahora también vende prendas de oro, zapatos, al contado y al crédito, pues ya tiene siete años en las ventas. Con el crédito que esta solicitando es para infraestructura en la compra de materiales de construcción para realizar divisiones de cuarto y sala para tener más privacidad con su familia. A largo plazo es poder tener una tienda con productos variados y terminar su carrera universitaria para lograr un trabajo y tener un buen ingreso.
texts.en:
Alyeris lives in the Hialeah III neighborhood of Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. She is a single 24 year old student, studying business administration at the university. Her schooling is expensive so her parents helped her start her own business to help with the costs. She began by selling cosmetics to other students at the university and she now has lots of customers. She also sells gold jewelry and shoes, partly for cash and partly on credit, and now has seven years in sales. The loan that she's applying for will be used to buy construction materials for subdividing rooms in her house so that she can gain more privacy from her family. In the long term, she wants to have a shop with various products and to finish her university studies so that she can find work and have a good income.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Subdivide rooms.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El señor Juan  habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, barrio que se ubica en la capital Managua, tiene  44 años de edad, se encuentra casado con la Sra. Mabel Tinoco Montenegro de 38 años, ella es amada de casa; ambos tienen dos hijos que están estudiando. Actualmente el señor  Juan  se desempeña como contador  en la alcaldía de Managua, tiene un  año de estar trabajando para esta institución, el desea seguir trabajando  con los créditos que otorga AFODENIC, para seguir mejorando las condiciones de la estructura de su casa, por tanto la nueva solicitud de crédito por un monto de C$ 5,000 a un plazo de 9 meses, para la construcción  de un muro en la parte de enfrente de su  casa, también tiene aspiraciones de seguir trabajando con mucha dedicación  para poder optar aun  mejor cargo    y  seguir apoyando a su de familia y mejorar las condiciones su  vivienda.
texts.en:
Juan lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood, which is located in the capital of Managua. Juan is 44 years old and married to Mrs. Mabel Tinoco Montenegro who is 38 years old and takes care of their home. They have two children that are in school. Juan is employed as an accountant for the city of Managua, where he has been working for one year. He would like to continue working with the loans offered by AFODENIC in order to continue improving the structural condition of his home. As such, he is requesting a new loan for $275 for a period of 9 months to build a wall in the front part of his house. He also aspires to continue working hard in his current job so he can take on better positions and continue supporting his family and improving their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall for his house.

loans.name: Jose Tomas

texts.es: El señor José habita en el barrio tres ochenta, barrio que se ubica en la capital Managua, tiene 29 años de vivir en su casa propia,  el señor José tiene 41 años de edad, se encuentra casado con la señora Marlene Haydee Cruz, que es comerciante vende refresco   y repostería, ella le  ayuda a su esposo en los gastos de la casa, ambos tienen tres hijos de diferentes edades de 20,  19 y 16 años de edad. Actualmente el señor José se desempeña como operario de limpieza en la  Alcaldía Municipal, teniendo 8 años de laborar en la institución, el aspira poder apoyar a su familia a través de ir mejorando su casa y poder en un futuro  establecer una pulpería para obtener mas ingresos para su hogar, el crédito que esta solicitando es para poner techo a su vivienda, por tanto el esta necesitando la cantidad de C$ 5, 000 aun plazo de 9  meses que es lo que requiere para la compra de zinc, puertas tablero y hierro para verjas.
texts.en:
Jose live in the 380 neighborhood in the capitol city of Managua. He is 41 years old and has lived in his own home for 29 years. He is married to Mrs. Marlene Haydee Cruz who sells refreshments and pastries, helping her husband with the costs of the home. They have three children of 20, 19, and 16 years of age. Jose is employed by the municipality, where he has worked as a sanitation operator for 8 years. He aspires to be able to support his family through improving his home and in the future to be able to open a general store to obtain more household income. The loan he is requesting is to put a roof on his home. He needs a loan of $275 for a period of 9 months. He needs the loan to purchase zinc, plywood, and iron for framing.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To put a roof on his house.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: El señor Efraín habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene la edad de 39 años, se encuentra casado con  la señora Fátima Dávila que tiene 30 años y es secretaria, ambos viven en casa propia y tienen un hijo de 7 años que esta estudiando. Actualmente el señor Efraín  se desempeña como oficial de la Policía Nacional, tiene 20 años dedicarse a esta profesión, el aspira seguir esforzándose para seguir contribuyendo a la seguridad del ciudadano y continuar sirviendo a su país, así mismo seguir mejorando las condiciones de vida de su familia, por tanto solicita un crédito de C$ 6,000 a un plazo de 9 meses, para la compra de cerámica y poder ponerle a su casa, ya que con los micro créditos que se le han  otorgado, el ha podido ir mejorando poco a poco su vivienda.
texts.en:
Efraín lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood, which is located in the capital of Managua. He is 39 years old and married to Fátima Dávila, who is 30 and is a secretary. They live in their own home and have a 7 year-old son who is a student. Efráin is currently an officer in the National Police, he has been in this profession for 20 years. He wants to keep working hard to make a contribution to the public´s safety and continue serving his country. He also wants to keep improving his family´s standard of living. For this, he is requesting a loan for C$6,000 over a period of 9 months, to buy tiles and install them in his house. With the microfinancing he has received he has been able to make improvements to his home bit by bit.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a tile floor in his home.

loans.name: Flor De Valle Alto Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de El Alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal de Villa Adela, a éste pertenece la asociación “Flor de Valle Alto” .Un grupo muy simpático y particular ya que además de trabajar juntas de manera muy responsable, llegaron a formar una muy linda amistad entre ellas. La mayoría  de ellas son artesanas, por ejemplo Arminda realiza singulares muñecos en aguayo (  Aguayo; Es un tejido rectangular de lana multicolor que sirve para cargar los niños u objetos a la espalda, entre otras cosas), que luego los vende el la calles turísticas  de la ciudad de La Paz; Julia realiza bordados de disfraces tradicionales, que los vende a pedido solamente.
La asociación Flor de Valle Alto necesita comprar  materia prima para ampliar sus ventas, así sus ingresos mejorarían para el bien de sus familias.
texts.en:
Villa Adela is located in the city of El Atlo, and it is a member of the "Flor de Valle Alto" association. They are a very happy group and they are unique because aside from working together, they have also formed a very beauty friendship among themselves. Most of them are artesans. Arminda, for example, makes unique dolls made from Aguayo - Aguayo is a knitted material made from wool dyed in various colours and it is a fabric usually used to carry babies or objects on the back, as a sling. She sells the dolls in the tourist areas in the city of La Pza. And Julia makes traditional needlepoint costumes and she takes orders for them.

The association "Flor de Valle Alto" requires to purchase supplies to increase their sales, and in turn, to increase their earnings, all for the good of their family.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.es: La señora Anabelle habita en el barrio Hialia III etapa, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene la edad de 43  años, se encuentra casada con el señor Roberto chavarria de 48 años de edad, el es técnico eléctrico y sastre trabaja por su cuenta  propia, donde también apoya a su esposa en los gastos de la casa; ambos tienen 3 hijos de 7, 6 y 2 años de edad que están estudiando. Actualmente doña Anabelle se desempeña  como costurera y trabaja en el negocio de costura  de la señora Claudia Ordóñez hace 4 años, así mismo la Sra. Anabelle desea establecer su propio taller y trabajarlo con su marido, por tanto solicita la cantidad de C$ 8, 000 a 9 meses, para la compra de materia prima y de maquinas de coser y de esta forma poder establecer su propio negocio y a la vez ayudar a la buena educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Anabelle lives in the Hialeah III neighborhood of Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. She is 43 years old and married to Robert Chavarria who is 48 years old. Roberto is an electrical technician and a tailor. He shares the household expenses with his wife. They have 3 children, 7, 6 and 2 years old, who are in school. Anabelle now works as a seamstress in a shop owned by Claudia Ordonez, something she's been doing for 4 years. She would like to set up her own workshop and operate it with her husband. She's applying for a C$8,000 loan, for 9 months, to buy basic materials and sewing machines so that she can set up her own business and, at the same time, help her children get a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic materials and sewing machines for tailoring business.

loans.name: Las Conquistadoras Group

texts.es:
En la zona de villa Adela, se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “Las conquistadoras” Un grupo muy simpático y particular formado por diez mujeres, trabajan de manera organizada hace un año.  Las actividades que realiza la asociación Las Conquistadoras, son de todo tipo, una de  ellas tiene una farmacia, otras realizan tejidos de chompas, también se  dedican a venta de accesorios para el cabello, venta de maletines, venta de mandiles , entre otros.
Afirman que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de productos al por mayor, para  poder ampliar sus negocios y generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
In the region of Villa Adela, in the area bearing the same name, there is an association named "Las Conquistadoras". They are a very happy group of ten women that hae been working together for the past year. The occupations held by "Las Conquistadoras" are of all sorts: one runs a pharmacy, others knit shawls, others sell hair styling products, bags, and aprons, among others.

They have stated that they require working capital to purchase their products and supplies in wholesale, so to expand their businesses and to improve their earnings.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Require working capital to purchase products and supplies wholesale.

loans.name: Mireya Luisa

texts.es: La señora Mireya habita en el barrio habita en el barrio Hialia III etapa, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene la edad de 33 años, se encuentra casada con el señor Sergio  Rivera de 37  años de edad el es electricistas y trabaja como responsable de mantenimiento, ambos tienen 4 hijos de 16, 11, 9 y 7 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando. Actualmente la señora Mireya se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos,  donde esta actividad la inicio con capital propio y con el objetivo de apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, hace 10 años que se dedica a este actividad y tiene el propósito de seguir creciendo con su  negocio, por tanto solicita el crédito de C$ 6,000 para la compra de mercadería y poder ofrecer mas productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mireya lives in he Hialia phase III neighborhood located in the capitol city of Managua. She is 33 years old and married to Mr. Sergio Rivera, who is 37 years old and is an electrician and works in maintenance. They have 4 children, 16, 11, 9, and 7 years old, who are all in school. Mireya sells clothing and cosmetics, a business she started with her own capital and with the goal of helping her husband with the costs of the home. For ten years she has performed this activity and intends to continue growing her business. As such, she is requesting a loan of $325 in order to purchase merchandise and to be able to offer more products to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purhcase cosmetics and clothing to sell in her store.

loans.name: Denis De Los Angeles

texts.es: El señor Denis habita el barrio Hialia III etapa, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 65 años de edad, se encuentra soltero y tiene a cargo a su nieta de 18 años, donde también el señor Denis desea trabajar con mucho esfuerzo, para apoyar a sus hijos. Actualmente se dedica a la comercialización de ropa y zapato; tiene 12 años de ejercer esta actividad, comenzó esta actividad con sus ahorros para poderlos invertir en su negocio, así mismo con la ayuda de los créditos  que AFODENIC le ha proporcionado el ha incrementado su inventario de su negocio y desea optar  a un nuevo crédito de C$ 3,000 a 9 meses, para la compra de mas mercadería y ofertarlas a sus clientes mayor variedad de  productos de ropa y zapato y a la vez aumentar el volumen de sus ventas.
texts.en:
Denis lives in the Hialia III Etapa neighborhood located in the capital of Managua. He is 65 years old and is alone. He has assumed responsibility for his 18-year-old granddaughter and would like to work hard to help out his children. He currently sells clothing and shoes and has been doing this for 12 years. He started the business by investing his savings. In addition, with the help of from loans from AFODENIC, he has increased his inventory. He would like another loan for C$3000 over 9 months so he can buy more merchandise and offer his customers a greater variety in clothing and shoes, and at the same time increase his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing and shoes to resell.

loans.name: Espigas De Oro Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Espigas de Oro” pertenece a la familia de  pro-mujer hace ya varios años cumpliendo su tercer ciclo de crédito, esta  se encuentra en la zona de Los Andes, de la ciudad de El Alto a la fecha el grupo  cuenta con 18 socias, que han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito.
Dentro el grupo la mayoría son casadas y con hijos, casi todos en edad escolar, existiendo algunos casos que por falta de recursos  lastimosamente  sus hijos tuvieron que abandonar  la escuela. Ya que estos deben ayudar a sus padres en sus pequeños negocios.
Existen diferentes negocios  dentro la asociación como ser; la venta de comida, la venta  de lácteos, ropa ligera, pero la actividad principal es la venta de papa, Lucia por ejemplo al igual que sus compañeras, se dedica a esta actividad hace mucho tiempo, vende este producto junto a su padre en el mercado de la Ceja (zona central de la ciudad de el Alto). La asociación Espigas de Oro necesita de  capital  para comprar productos en mayor cantidad, con la seguridad de ampliar sus ganancias para obtener estabilidad económica en sus hogares.
texts.en:
The association "Espigas de Oro" belongs to the same business family of Pro-Mujer. Many years ago they completed their third loan cycle. The association is located in the region of Los Andes in the city of El Alto. To date, the group consists of 18 members and they have shown themselves to be a well-organized group especially when dealing with their loan.

The members of the group are mostly married women with children, most of whom are school-aged. There are a few children that were sadly forced to leave school because their family lacked financial resources, and they end up helping the parents run the small businesses.

Many types of businesses are being run by the members of the group, such as: food sales, dairy sales, and clothing sales. But the most common business is the sale of potatoes. Lucia, for example, much like her other colleagues, she has been selling for a great long while alongside her father in the markets of Ceja (the central region of the city of El Alto). The association "Espigas de Oro" requires working capital to purchase products in greater quantities, with the aim of increasing their earnings to establish a better financial situation for their homes.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to purchase products in greater quantities.

loans.name: Giovana

texts.es: Giovana tiene 33 años, es madre de dos hijos de 12 años y 10 años, el padre de ellos, lo abandonó hace muchos años atrás, ahora vive con su nueva pareja, Omar, con quien tuvo un hijo, pero que lamentablemente murió hace poco.  Era un jueves por la mañana como siempre salía a vender rodajas de piñas y tamales en su canasta, no presagiaba que su hijo caería al río, después de muchos días de búsqueda hallaron el cuerpo, ella quiso morir y no trabajar más; pero aun le quedaban dos hijos y por ellos, trata de reponerse en sus actividades, por la mañana prepara el desayuno y el almuerzo para sus hijos, después sale a vender tamales y las rodajas de piñas a los pasajeros de los autos. Le gusta mucho esa actividad, aunque hay mucha competencia dice, a veces lo que le dificulta es que no termina de vender sus tamales, entonces los deja para consumo propio, y sus ganancias bajan.  Tras la desgracia que le tocó vivir, trata de sacar fuerzas y trabajar por sus dos menores hijos.  El dinero que está solicitando lo va invertir en la compra de piñas y otras frutas para abrir una  juguería en un pequeño local alquilado.
texts.en:
Giovana is 33 years old and is a mother of two children, ages 12 and 10. The children's father abandoned the family many years ago, and now she lives with her new partner, Omar, with whom she also had a child, but sadly the baby died shortly after. It was a Thursday morning and like always she left to sell pineapple slices and tamales from her basket, not knowing that her son would fall into the river. After many days of looking, the body was found, and Giovana wanted to day and not work anymore. But she still had her other two children, and for them she tried to resume her activities. In the morning, she prepares their breakfast and lunch before leaving to sell her foods to drivers passing by. She really enjoys the activity, even though she says there's a lot of competition and sometimes she has trouble selling all of her tamales, which she then keeps for herself, and her earnings drop. After the hardship she endured, she tries to stay strong and work for her children. With the loan she is requesting, she will invest in the purchase of pineapples and other fruits to open a juice stand at a small rented storefront.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Start a juice stand business

loans.name: Saro

texts.en:
Saro M., 51, is a farmer who lives in Chrey Krem Village, Phteah Rung Commune, Pursat Province. He is very experienced in this business as he has been farming since 1979. Currently, he earns approximately US$1.50 per day. He is married to Mrs. Ty Nhep, 52, who is a housewife; in other words, Ty stays home to care for their children and to cook food for the family. Indeed, Ty has a difficult task because they have eight children, four of whom are married while the other children are young and attend school.

Unfortunately, Saro's farmland is infertile, so he is in need of a loan in the amount of 700,000 Riel (US$175) to purchase fertilizer to use on his rice crop. Ty hopes the loan will allow him to increase his rice yield above and beyond what it was in previous years. As for his future plan, he wants all of his children to go to university and to get good jobs.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to use on his rice crop

loans.name: Huor's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan and there are six members. Mr. Huor S. is one member of the group and has been selected to be leader. Huor is 23 years old and he breeds pig to sell. Normally, he purchases piglets from other breeders and he sells them for slaughter after four months. Huor has been breeding pigs since 2005 and currently can earn around US$2.33 per day. He is married to Mrs. Nhem Beak and has four children. His wife is a roasted chicken seller in her local market. With his family growing from day to day, and needing to increase income, Huor wants to expand his amount of pigs to breed. Hence, he needs a loan of US$300 to purchase 10 pigs to breed.

The other five group members are:

1) Mrs. Sinan S., a young woman who sells groceries. She requests a loan of US$300 to purchase grocery inventory to sell.

2) Mr. Ret L., who breeds pigs to sell and requests a loan of US$300 to purchase more pigs to breed.

3) Mr. Kan K., who is a farmer and requests a loan of US$300 to pay for plowing farmland to grow vegetables and fruit trees.

4) Mr. Tey T., who is a farmer and sells chopped wood as well. He requests a loan of US$300 to purchase a machine to chop wood to sell.

5) Mrs. Sophal P., who grows vegetables to sell and requests a loan of US$300 for a pump to use for her vegetable crop.

This group of people live in Paksneng Commune, Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To purchase 10 pigs to breed

loans.name: Fatma's Group

texts.en:
Fatma has been selling food in Zanzibar for three years. She works daily from 7:00am to 6:00pm and earns a monthly profit of approximately $65. She is hoping that by taking out her first loan, she will be able to expand her business and increase her earnings.

Fatma will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Harifa, Mtumwa, Mtama and Habiba.

loans.use: To buy more food to sell in her business.

loans.name: Mwatum's Group

texts.en:
Mwatum has had a shop selling dresses and shoes in Zanzibar since 2006. She is 25 years old, single, and has no children. She works every day from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m., which enables her to earn a monthly profit of approximately $125. She is requesting this loan in order buy more dresses and shoes at wholesale prices to resell in her shop.

Mwatum will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members: Asha, Najma, Saada and Somoe.

loans.use: To buy more dresses and shoes to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 43-year-old Christina D. from Mwanza. She is widowed with three children, between the ages of eleven and twenty-three. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependants because their parents died. Christina has been running a business since 1996, selling maize. She works at the business for twelve hours per day, six days per week. Christina currently earns about 100USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to buy more maize. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and stock of maize. Christina thanks you for supporting her!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow large sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more maize

loans.name: Sothavy's Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan, and there are four group members. Mrs. Sothavy Thom is one member of the group, and she was selected to be the group leader. Sothavy is 24 years old, and she grows vegetables on her farmland (behind her house) and later sells the vegetables at the market. By doing so, she earns approximately US$4 per day. In addition, Sothavy is married to Mr. Mak Orn; they do not have any children. She is seeking a loan in the amount of US$150 to purchase fertilizer to use on her vegetable crops. The other three group members are as follows:

1 Mrs. Sokhem P. grows vegetables to sell, and she also requests a loan in the amount of US$150 to purchase fertilizer for her vegetable crops;

2 Mrs. Chantha T. grows vegetable crops, and she seeks a loan in the amount of US$100 to purchase fertilizer; and

3 Mr. Noeum C. has a rice mill, and he requests a loan in the amount of US$100 to purchase rice to then grind for sale.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to use on her vegetable crops

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 41-year-old Vicky B. from Mwanza, married with two children, both 18 years old. Vicky has been running a shop since 2006 selling rice, beans, maize flour, soaps, sugar, and tea leaves. Working at the business for 16 hours per day, 6 days per week and assisted by her son, Vicky currently earns about $100 per month.

She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy additional maize flour, rice, beans, soaps, sugar, and tea leaves. In the future, she plans to increase the range and quantity of stocks. Vicky thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, rice, beans, soaps, sugar, and tea leaves.

loans.name: Alijon

texts.en: Alijon has been in an agro-business for more than 6 years. He grows onions and wheat, and also has a business fattening cattle. That is how he supports his family. He wants to buy more fertilizers and use them on onions to get a higher yield. With the money from his yield and business, he wants to help his son to marry.

loans.use: To purchase chemical fertilizers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is thirty-five-year-old, Mary P. from Mwanza. She is married with three children, between the ages of six and thirteen. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependants because they are orphans.

Mary has been running an African print cloth shop since 2002. She works at the business for sixteen hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by her sister. Mary currently earns about US$ 200 per month from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 400 in order to buy more African print cloth. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Mary thanks you for supporting her!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

loans.use: To buy more African print cloth for re-sale

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:

Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependant who is an orphan. Monica has been running a business since 2000, selling fish. She works at the business for eight hours per day, six days per week, and is assisted by two employees. Monica currently earns about 300USD per month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to buy more fish to sell. In the future, she plans to increase her stock of fish. Monica thanks you for your support!

loans.name: Tahira's Group

texts.en:
Tahira Baji is the wife of M. T. and lives in a small area named Riwind of Kasur, Pakistan. It is a half hour from Kasur. Riwind is an area full of fruits and vegetable markets. Tahira Baji owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last eight years. She is the mother of two daughters. Her elder daughter is 4 years old and her younger daughter is 2 years old. Tahira Baji's husband has a scrap business where he sells particularly iron. He has been in this business for the last 8 years. Tahira Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more iron for her husband's scrap business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Tahira Baji wants a loan to buy woods to resell. Shahnaz Baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Razia Baji wants a loan to buy milk to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy iron for scrap business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Rose M. from Mwnza. Married with four children between the ages of three and ten, Rose has been running a shop since 2006. Assisted by her husband, she sells salt, soaps, sugar, eggs, maize flour, wheat flour, and biscuits. She works at the business 12 hours per day, 6 days per week, currently earning about $200 per month.

Rose is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy soda, water, lotions, soaps, vouchers, rice, cooking oil, and wheat flours. In the future, she plans to increase the range and quantity of stocks. Rose thanks you for your support!

loans.name: Rahmani's Group

texts.en:
Rahmani Baji is the wife of M. I. and lives in a small area named Riwind o Kasur, Pakistan. It is a half hour from Kasur. Riwind is an area full of fruits and vegetable markets. Rahmani Baji is married for the last 30 years. She is the mother of five sons. All of her sons run their own barber saloon. They have been in this business for the last 10 years. Rahmani Baji's husband makes car seat covers and sells them in the market. He has been in this business for the last 22 years. Rahmani Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy chairs, a mirror and tools for her sons' barber saloon.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Jamila Baji wants a loan to buy more seasonal fruits to resell. Parveen Baji and Khursheed Baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material (chairs, mirrors) for barber saloon

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra baji is the wife of M. and lives in a small area named Riwind outside the city Kasur, Pakistan. It is half an hour in distance from city Kasur. Riwind is an area full of fruit and vegetable markets. Bushra baji owns a two roomed brick house and has been living in it for the last 8 years. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Bushra baji's husband has worked in a factory for the last 6 years. Bushra baji herself has a milk selling business. She collects the milk from a milkshop and goes door-to-door to sell milk at houses, and collects profit on a monthly basis. She has been in this business for the last 5 years. She is applying for a loan to expand her milk business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Hajra baji wants a loan to buy an embroidery machine to make embroidered dresses. Samina baji and N. Jehan baji each want a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes. Khatoon baji wants a loan to buy thread to resell. Mubeen baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more milk to resell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 28-year-old Esther N. from Mwanza. She is married with one child, one year old. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependant who is an orphan. Esther has been running a pharmacy business since 2006, selling medicines. She works at the business for twelve hours per day, seven days per week, and is assisted by her husband. Esther currently earns about 350USD per month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to buy more medicines, such as Chestcof, Strepsils, Mucolyn, Hedex and others. In the future, she plans to increase her stocks of medicines. Esther thanks you for supporting her!

loans.name: Maryam M. Ishaq Group

texts.en:
Maryam Baji is the widow of M. Ishaq and lives in a small area named Riwind of Kasur, Pakistan. It is half an hour from Kasur. Riwind is an area full of fruits and vegetable markets. Maryam Baji has been living in this area for the last 31 years. She is the mother of five children: four sons and one daughter. Her elder son has a grocery shop. The next has a shuttering business. Her younger sons are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Her daughter makes thread and sells it in the market. Maryam Baji also helps her daughter in making thread. She is applying for a loan to buy beams to expand her son's shuttering business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Suraiya Baji wants a loan to buy thread to resell. Naseem Baji wants a loan to buy more seasonal fruits to resell. Zareena Baji wants a loan to buy medicines for her clinic.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy beams for shuttering business

texts.en:

Assisted by one employee, she works at the business for eight hours per day, five days per week, currently earning about $300 per month.

She is requesting a loan of $675 in order to buy a deep freezer, and in the future plans to increase her ice cream stock. Sophia thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Nasreen Bibi is the wife of M. A. and lives in an area named Riwind of Kasur, Pakistan. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 10 years. She is the mother of five daughters. Her younger daughter is in 11th standard. The others are working in a cotton factory. Nasreen Baji's husband works in a factory. Nasreen Baji herself makes thread and sells it in a market. She has been involved in this business for the last 6 years. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy a thread-making machine so that she is able to make more thread and sell it in the market to earn a good profit.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Maqsoodan Baji wants a loan to buy wood to make furniture to resell. Nasreen Baji wants a loan to buy another bicycle for her bicycle rental business. Parveen Baji wants a loan to buy more clothes to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

She is the mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. Her elder daughter reads in 9th standard. The next to her is in 7th standard. Her younger daughter is in kindergarten. Both of her sons are in 3rd standard. Ameen baji's husband runs a grocery shop. Ameen baji is a housewife and also sews clothes of her neighbors. She successfully repaid her four loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more groceries for her husband's grocery shop.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Bilquis baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy more clothes to resell. Noor baji also wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for grocery shop

Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependants who are orphans. Hilda has been running a chicken and cattle business since 2004, selling chickens and milk. She works at the business for twelve hours per day, seven days per week, and is assisted by four employees. Hilda currently earns about 200USD per month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to buy more chicks. In the future, she plans to increase her stock of chickens. Hilda thanks you for supporting her!

Mambo from Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Esther B. from Mwanza. She is married with four children, between the ages of two and nine. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting one dependant who is an orphan. Esther has been running a business since 2004, selling fruits. She works at the business for eight hours per day, six days per week, and is assisted by her husband. Esther currently earns about 200USD per month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to buy avocados, pawpaws, oranges, cucumbers and bananas. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Esther thanks you for supporting her!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow large sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy avocados, pawpaws, oranges, cucumbers and bananas

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is twenty-eight-year-old Mary M. from Mwanza. She is married with three children, between the ages of three and ten. Mary has been running a cloth and tailoring business since 1999. She works at the business twelve hours per day, six days per week. Mary currently earns about US$ 100 per month from her business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 400 in order to buy more cloth for re-sale. In the future, she plans to open a new shop selling cloth wholesale. Mary thanks you for supporting her!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for re-sale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Grace N. from Mwanza. She is divorced with one child, aged eight. Grace has been running a beauty salon since 2006. She works at the business for twelve hours per day, six days per week, and is assisted by one employee. Grace currently earns about 450USD per month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400USD in order to buy one drier and cosmetics. In the future, she plans to open another beauty salon. Grace thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow large sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy one drier and cosmetics

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 37-year-old Rosemary M. from Mwanza, a widow with three children between the ages of 11 to 15. Rosemary has been operating a tailoring business since 2007, but also sells perfumes, soaps, and sandals. Working 12 hours per day, 6 days a week, she currently earns about $120 each month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy cloth and shoes to sell, and in the future she plans to open a cloth business. Rosemary thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy cloth and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Zaituni I. from Mwanza. She is widowed with four children between the ages of 18 and 24 and also supports two dependents because they are orphans. Zaituni has been running a tailoring business since 1980. Working 12 hours a day, 6 days per week, Zaituni currently earns about $250 each month from her business.

She is requesting a loan of $325 in order to buy a tailoring machine and cloth, and in the future plans to increase her range and stock of cloth. Zaituni thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy one tailoring machine and cloth.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Mamadou D. est un boutiquier de plus de cinq ans d'activités, il investit dans d'autres secteurs comme le "tangana" qu'il a confié à d'autres proches parents. Il fait des chiffres d'affaires de vingt à trentes milles francs par jours. Il est marié et pére de deux enfants qu'il entretiens bien grâce à ses différents bénéfice. Ce crédit lui a permis de renforcer ses activités. Il a une boutique à scat urbam mariste et au belvédére.
texts.en:
Mamadou D. has been running shops for more than five years. He invests in other sectors such as "tangana" which he entrusted to close relatives. His revenue amounts to 20'000 to 30'000 XOF (40 to 60 USD). He's married and the father of two children whom he supports with his various revenues. This loan will enable him to bolster his business. He has a shop in Scat Urbam and in Belvédère (Dakar Region).

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retailing of various products

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Madame Khady T. est une commerçante expérimentée dans son domaine. Elle a toujours fait du commerce produits alimentaires depuis plus de dix ans. Elle est mére de famille et grâce à ses activités, elle entretiens sa famille et s'occupe bien d'elle. elle fait des chiffres d'affaires de dix à quinze milles francs cfa par jours. Ce crédit accordé va lui permettre de renforcer ses activités et augmanter ainsi ses bénéfices pour le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Khady T. is a merchant with a good deal of experience. She has sold foodstuffs for more than 10 years. She is the mother of a family and thanks to her earnings, she supports her family and takes good care of them. She has a turnover of about 10-15,000 CFA per day. The loan that she is requesting will allow her to bolster her business and increase her earnings for the well-being of her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of foodstuffs

loans.name: Maria Nela

texts.es: La señora Maria Nela habita en el barrio Batahola Norte, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 27 años, se encuentra acompañada del señor Daniel Enrique Rodriguez, el se dedica a la supervisión de construcción, tienen un hijo de 7 años. Actualmente la señora Maria Nela se dedica a su negocio que es una pulpería, donde vende al por menor diferentes productos de granos basicos,  tiene 2 años de tener su negocio, donde comenzó con capital  propio y en los  últimos años ha venido trabajando como mucho esfuerzo  para poder   ampliar su negocio, por tanto recurre al micro crédito para solicitar fondos para incrementar su inventario y obtener mayores ventas, ella esta solicitando la cantidad de C$ 6,000 a un plazo de 9 meses para invertirlo en su pequeña pulpería.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Nela lives in the town of North Batahola, in the capital city of Managua, Nicaragua. She is 27-years old and lives with her companion Mr. Daniel Enrique Rodriguez, who is a construction supervisor. Together they have a 7-year old child. Currently, Mrs. Nela has a business where she sells various basic grains. She has maintained this business for the last 2-years that initially started with equity. In recent years she has been working hard to be able to expand her business and has resorted to applying for a loan to increase her store’s inventory and generate more sales. She requests a loan of $6,000 to be repaid in 9 months for her little shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more inventory products for her store.

loans.name: Armando Antonio

texts.es: El señor Armando habita el barrio Pantasma, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 30 años de edad, se encuentra acompañado de la señora  Reyna Isabel de 37 años de edad, ella es ama de casa, ambos tienen dos hijos de 10 y 7 años. Actualmente el señor  Armando se dedica a su pequeño negocio que es una pulpería donde vende diferentes productos de granos básicos, hace 1 año que comenzó esta actividad, ya que antes se desempeñaba como guardia de seguridad, pero decidió  poner su propio negocio, por tanto desea trabajar con  micro créditos para poder seguir creciendo en su negocio y solicita C$ 5,000 a un  plazo   de 6 meses, para comprar mas inventario e invertirlo en su pulpería, del tal forma esto le permita tener mas clientes.
texts.en:
Armando lives in the Pantasma neighborhood of Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. He is 30 years old and lives with Reyna Isabel, a housewife, who is 37 years old. They have two children, 10 and 7 years old. Armando now operates a small grocery business where he sells various kinds of basic foodstuffs. He started the grocery a year ago when he was working as a security guard because he wanted to own his own business. He wants to use micro-loans so that he can go on growing his business and he's applying for a C$5,000 loan, for 6 months, to buy more inventory and to invest in his grocery so that he can attract more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more inventory and invest in grocery business.

loans.name: María Jesús

texts.es:
Maria Jesús tiene 47 años. Ella es Presidenta de la Asociación de Mamás Tejedoras y, no es para menos, sueña en grande, a nombre de la asociación: exportación de sus productos de lana y tener una cadena de taxis; debido a lo precaria de su calidad de vida junto con sus 2 menores hijas, de 8 y 9 años, así como de los ínfimos ingresos que tiene a pesar de tener más de 10 años como tejedora.

Maria Jesús requiere un préstamo de 500 soles, para poder contar con un mayor capital en aras de la próxima temporada navideña que le auguraría mayores ganancias y, apreciando en la foto lo diverso de su arte, es algo que no nos quepa la menor duda.
texts.en:
Maria Jesus is 47-years old. She is the President of the Weaving Mothers Association. She dreams great things for the association; in particular she wants to see the wool products the women make being exported and she wants a string of transporting vehicles.

Because of their precarious quality of life with her two young girls (ages 8 and 9), as well as earning little despite having more than 10-years of experiencing weaving, Maria Jesus requests a loan of $500 to have more capital in time for the approaching holiday season as she predicts higher future sales. Also, the loan will go towards furthering the diversity of art in photography, something she has no doubt will succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build capital in anticipation of higher sales and to invest in photographic art.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: hola mi nombre es Mario V., tengo 36 años de edad, soy casado, mi actividad principal es el comercio cuento con un negocio de venta de electrodomesticos los que distribuyo de manera ambulante en la ciudad y sus alrededores tambien trabajo por encaargos, gracias a este negocio tengo mi casita y le puedo proporcionar la educacion a mis hijos, pero en la actualidad necesito mas inversion ya que se aproxima la navidad y en esta epoca las ventas son muy buenas y las demandas de mis clientes se estan incrementando mucho, tambien necesito tener mas variedad de producto. por tal razon necesito un credito para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Hello, my name is Mario V.. I am 36-years-old and married. I have a business in which I sell appliances, which I distribute as a street vendor in the city and its surrounding areas. I also work by taking orders. Thanks to this business, I have a house and can educate my children. Currently I need more investment since Christmas is coming, and sales are very good during this season. My customers' demands are increasing a lot. I also need more variety of products. For this reason I need a credit to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of electronic appliances for the home

loans.name: Aida

texts.es: La señora Aida habita el barrio Carlos Fonseca, barrió ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 54 años de edad, se encuentra soltera y tiene  4 hijos. Actualmente la señora Aída se dedica a la docencia, prestando los servicios de docencia en primaria y a la vez se dedica a vender cosméticos, donde tiene 3 años de dedicarse a estas actividades, ella requiere de financiamiento para poder seguir creciendo con su pequeño negocio de venta de cosméticos y perfumes, por tanto esta solicitando un crédito de C$ 7,000 aun plazo de 8 meses, para la compra de mercadería y poder ofrecer mas variedad de productos a sus clientes y a la vez de esta forma obtener mas ingresos y poder ayudar a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Aida lives in the Carlos Fonseca neighborhood of Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. She is 54 years old and single with 4 children. Aida works as a teacher, lending her services to elementary school teaching, and at the same time, operates a cosmetics sales business. She's been operating the business for 3 years.
