She needs financing to continue growing her small business, selling cosmetics and perfumes, so she's asking for a C$7,000 loan, for 8 months, to buy merchandise so that she can offer a wider range of products to her customers. She wants to increase her income and be able to help improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Eleazer Rafael

texts.es: El señor Eleazar habita el barrio Villa Reconciliación, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 24 años de edad, se encuentra soltero, actualmente el se dedica a la sastrería, donde apoya en el negocio de su mama, negocio que inicio con ahorros de su mama y el ahora lo esta administrando y a la vez dedicándose al trabajo de sastrería, tiene 8 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, y el esta requiriendo de financiamiento para seguir apoyando a su mama en el negocio familiar de sastrería, por tanto esta solicitando un crédito por la cantidad de C$ 6,000 aun plazo de 6  meses, para la compra de una maquina de coser industrial y de esta forma poder un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ya que en un futuro desea ir mejorando poco a poco el negocio de sastrería que tiene su mama, para poder ir incrementando sus clientelas.
texts.en:
Eleazar lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood, located in the capital of Managua. He is 24 years old and single. He is a tailor and helps with his mother´s business, which she started with her savings and which he runs while at the same time working as a tailor. He has been doing this for 8 years. He needs financing in order to continue helping his mother in the family business and is requesting a loan for C$8,000 over 6 months to buy an industrial sewing machine so he can give better service to his customers. In the future he would like to make improvements little by little to the tailoring business that his mother has and to increase his customer base.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Perlas De Oriente Group

texts.es:
hola nosotras somos el grupo Perla de Oriente, esamos ubicadas en el municipio de danli, nosotras nos conocemos muy bien y hemos trabajado juntas siempre, ya que somos vecinas.
nuestro grupo se integra de la siguiente forma:
Santos H.: soy la coordinadora del grupo, vendo cosmeticos y ropa, actividad que realizo hace varios años y atravez de este negocio he sacado ganancias para contribuir con los gastos del hogar y asi poder mejorar nuestras condiciones de vida.
Maria P.: ella vende cosmeticos y ropa, tiene mas de 6 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, la cual realiza de forma ambulante y domiciliar, este negocio es su fuente de generacion de dinero, y con las ganancias que ella obtiene ayuda a cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
Margarita F.: la actividad de ella es la venta de medicina popular tiene 2 años de vender este tipo de producto, ella no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para invertir en su negocio e implementar nuevos productos.
por tal razon nosotras hemos dedicido obtener un credito monetario para poder abastecernos de productos y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Hello, we are the group, Pearl of the Orient, and we are located in the town of Danli. Since we are neighbors, we know each other very well, and we have always worked together. Our group is composed as follows: Santos H.: I am the coordinator of the group, and I sell cosmetics and clothes. I started selling these products several years ago, and through this business, I have made profits to help with my household expenses and in order to improve our living conditions. Maria P.: She sells cosmetics and clothes and has more than six years of experience engaging in this type of business, which she performs while traveling and at home. This business is her source of generating money, and with the profits that she gets, she helps to cover household expenses. Margarita F.: Her business is the selling of popular medicines, and she has two years experience selling these types of products. She does not have sufficient working capital to invest in her business and implement new products. For this reason, we are dedicated to getting a monetary loan in order to supply more products and obtain better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of goods, cosmetics, clothing, medicine, etc.

loans.name: Maria Fidelina

texts.es: La señora Maria Fedelina habita el barrio Walter Ferreti, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 54 años de edad, se encuentra casada con el señor Nestor Zeledón que es supervisor, ambos tienen 4 hijos. Actualmente la señora Maria Fidelina se dedica a la venta de lotería y de productos naturales, hace mas de 13 años tiene de dedicarse a esta actividad, donde en conjunto de su marido han venido trabajan con mucho esfuerzo para poder siempre ayudar a su familia y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos, por tanto esta solicitando un crédito d e C$ 10,000 a un plazo de  6 meses para comprar mas productos naturales y mas lotería,  de esta forma poder incrementar su clientes y su niveles de ingreso para seguir realizando mejoras en la vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Fedelina lives in the Walter Ferreti neighborhood located in the capital city of Managua. She is 54 years old and is married to Nestor Zeledon who is a supervisor. They have four children. Maria Fidelina currently dedicates herself to the sale of lottery tickets and natural products. She has been in this business for more than 13 years together with her husband. They put a lot of effort into their work in order to help their family and improve their children's quality of life. She is asking for a loan in the amount of $525 which she will repay in six months. The loan will be used to purchase more natural products and lottery tickets. This will allow her to increase the number of clients and her income so that she can keep improving her family's life.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more inventory of natural products and lottery tickets.

loans.name: Nazario

texts.es:
Teniendo ya 74 años, el señor Nazario cuenta con un solo trabajo desde hace 42 años: panadero, que apenas le ha permitido subsistir con sus hijos y, como se aprecia en la imagen, aún le es insuficiente para poder financiar el levantamiento de un lugar seguro para vivir en su propio hogar y, específicamente, un ambiente adecuadamente implementado para poder vender sus panes bajo su techo y no en triciclo como lo hace actualmente, viendo beneficiados así, su estado de salud así como los ingresos para tan noble negocio.


Es así que el señor Nazario solicita la cantidad de 700 soles para poder terminar de construir dicho ambiente en su casa en pos de alcanzar cierta prosperidad en líneas generales para con su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Nazario is 74-years old and has been working as a baker for 42-years. He barely makes enough money to support his children as witnessed in this picture. He does not have sufficient funds to raise a safe roof under which to live and sell his baked goods; currently he sells the baked good by tricycle and knows he’ll see sales and improve his health for this very noble business.

Mr. Nazario requests a loan for $700 soles to finish the construction on his home to create an atmosphere in pursuit of a certain level of prosperity, in general, for their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish the construction on his home to work out of his house.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es: El señor Fidel habita el barrio Maria Auxiliadora, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 57 años de edad, se encuentra   casado con la señora Maria Solórzano, que es ama de casa, ambos tienen dos hijos  de 16 y 7 años de edad, son estudiante de secundaria. Actualmente el señor Fidel es transportista, el tiene su propio taxi y el mismo lo conduce, tiene 30 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, donde inicio con esta actividad alquilando  vehículos y luego solicito un financiamiento para poder obtener su propio vehiculo y de esta manera poder tener mayores ingresos en su familia y prestarle mejores condiciones de vida a su esposa y sus hijos, por tanto solicita este crédito de C$ 7,000 a un  plazo de 10 meses para realizarle mejoras a su vivienda, ya que necesita comprar material de construcción Gypsum.
texts.en:
Fidel works in the region of Maria Auxiliadora, a region located in the capital city of Managua. He is 57 years old and he is married to Maria Solorzano. She stays home with both of their children aged 16 and 7 years, and they are attending school. Fidel is a taxi driver. He owns his own taxi and he drives it himself. He has been driving it for the last 30 years and he started out by renting a car. He later requested a loan to get his own car, to have a better income for his family and provide them with a better quality of life. He is requesting a loan of C$7000, to be repaid in a term of 10 months, to renovate their home. He needs to purchase building material especially Gympsum.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase building materials to remodel their home.

loans.name: Cynthia Milagros

texts.es:
Cynthia tiene 20 años. Tras haber estudiado 6 meses, viene trabajando desde hace un año como masajista dependientemente pero en mente tiene lo siguiente: primero, volverse independiente como masajista asociada con una amiga y, segundo, estudiar Terapia Física (3 años de duración) y complementar el curso de 6 meses que tomó inicialmente, ambos proyectos, de realizarse, le depararían mayores ingresos económicos para ella y su familia así como tranquilidad en su hogar, que la imagen de su madre mostrando su foto y tarjetas del trabajo hablen por sí solas de la unión y pujanza de tan humilde familia.


Para lograr tales metas, Cynthia necesita de 500 soles en aras de volver sus sueños realidad y convertir esas perspectivas en infinitas y, con tan temprana edad, convertirla en paradigma de la mujer peruana emprendedora.
texts.en:
Cynthia is 20 years old. After studying for six months, Cynthia has been working for the last year as a masseuse, but with the following in mind: first, become an independent licensed masseuse with a friend of hers and second, to study physical therapy (a three year course) which will complement the original six month course that she took. Both projects she hopes will improve her family's income level and other factors such as the tranquility of her home, the image of her work that her mother shows in these pictures and cards, and the work skills that reflect the unity and strength of this humble family. To achieve her goals, Cynthia needs a 500 soles loan to help truly achieve her dream of owning of her own business and become, despite her young age, the paradigm of the entrepreneurial Peruvian woman.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To work independently and invest in education which will improve her income

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Socorro se dedica a la venta de limones, al contar con familia en el norte del Perú, donde prolifera el cultivo de dicho fruto, viaja cada 2 semanas a traer mercadería y los expende a los ambulantes de la zona, lo cual le resta ganancias y, si tomamos en cuenta la coyuntura mundial y del país mismo, es que los costos se encarecen (alza de los pasajes y precio de limones) y su ganancia se limita incluso más, por lo que le urge tomar cartas en el asunto.


La señora Socorro necesita de 500 soles en pro de poder adquirir más mercadería y poder viajar más seguido para poder no sólo vender dicha mercadería a los ambulantes sino a comerciantes de los mercados de la zona, logrando incrementar sus ingresos y poder optar por una calidad de vida mucho mejor para su familia y, en sí, para sus 2 nietos a quienes adora y vela tanto por su salud y educación.
texts.en:
Mrs. Socorro is dedicated to selling lemons. She lives with her family in the Northern part of Peru, where there is widespread cultivation of this fruit. She travels every two weeks to bring the merchandise to the bargainers in the area, though it reduces her earnings. Taking into account the environment and the country itself, the costs is great (for shipping and the prices for lemons), thus it limits things all the more.

Mrs. Socorro needs $500 soles to buy more merchandise and to be able to travel more frequently to sell not only to the bargainers, but to other traders in the market. She wants to realize more income and be able to provide a better quality of life for her family. She also wants the best for her two grandchildren that they may have good health and the best education.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to increase trade.

loans.name: Carmen Raquel

texts.es:
La señora Carmen cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en tejidos, su arte ya vio tierra extranjera a través de una de sus hermanas, por lo que ve un atisbo del sueño que tuvo cuando apenas se iniciaba como tejedora: exportar sus productos. Su trabajo es exquisito y el hambre de éxito de Carmen hizo que fingiera un stand en plena sala de su casa en pos de promocionar parte de su obra.


La señora Carmen requiere 700 soles para poder solventar tan maravillosa creatividad volcada en sus productos, que irán destinados a la compra de lana de alpaca e hilo de primera calidad, digna de exportación peruana.
texts.en:
Carmen has 10 years of experience in knitting. Her art has been seen in other countries through one of her sisters. This has allowed her to see a hint of the dream she had when she began knitting: to export her products. Her work is exquisite and her drive for success led Carmen to fashion a kind of stand in the living room of her home in order to promote her handiwork. Carmen needs a loan for 700 soles to buy high-quality alpaca wool and thread in order to afford to keep making marvelous creations worthy of becoming Peruvian exports.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for her business

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La señora Anita tiene 48 años. Se dedica a muchas cosas que, ni en su conjunto, logran darle una calidad de vida adecuada a ella ni a su esposo taxista de 53 ni a su hijo de 12 años que cursa el 1º grado de secundaria, componentes de su hogar. Anita cocina menúes, lava ropa y, a lo que le dedica mayor tiempo y, obviamente, lo que le depara un mayor ingreso es a los tejidos de lana.


Estando cercana la temporada navideña, época del año en que más productos de lana vende, es que solicita encarecidamente un préstamo de 600 soles para poder plasmar toda aquella creatividad en los tejidos por lo que el dinero financiaría los implementos necesarios para su cometido.
texts.en:
Anita (or "Little Ms. Ana") is 48 years old. She engages in a variety of endeavors that collectively succeed in providing adequate support neither for herself, her 53-year-old husband who drives a taxicab, her 12-year-old son who is in his first year of secondary school, nor for their home. Anita cooks meals, takes in laundry and weaves items out of wool, an activity to which she devotes most of her time and which obviously provides greater income. Since the Christmas season is approaching, a time of year when she sells more wool products, Anita is urgently requesting a loan of $200 (600 nuevos soles), money that would finance the supplies needed to be able to translate all that creativity into finished products.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for the Christmas season

loans.name: Ivette Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Ivette  habita en el barrio Santa Rosa, barrio ubicado en la capital de Managua, tiene 36 años de edad, se encuentra casada con el señor Ofilio Castro, que es comerciante; ambos tienen 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando, viven en casa propia hace mas de 20 años. Actualmente la señora Ivette se dedica a la venta de ropa y CD, que inicio con esta actividad con su propio dinero  hace 8 años, ella ha venido creciendo poco a poco, por tanto requiere de crédito para invertir mas en su negocio  y esta necesitando la cantidad de C$  20,000 aun plazo de 12 meses para la compra de mas inventario y así poder ofrecer màs variedad a sus clientes, ya que sus planes a futuro en seguir  creciendo y desarrollando mas su negocio para poder darle una mejor estabilidad económica a su familia.
texts.en:
Ivette lives in the Santa Rosa neighborhood which is located in the capital city of Managua. She is 36 years old and is married to Ofilio Castro who is a tradesman. They have 3 children who are in school and have lived in their own home for over 20 years. Ivette currently dedicates herself to the sale of clothing and CDs. She started this business with her own money eight years ago. The business has been slowly growing and she needs a loan of $1025 which she will repay in 12 months in order to purchase more inventory and to sell outside of the country. Her plans for the future are to keep growing and developing her business in order to provide better economic stability for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and CDs.

loans.name: Carmen Luz

texts.es:
La señora Carmen tiene 56 años y hace 5 puso su bodega donD. expenD. albarrotes y cerveza, por mencionar los que le deparan mayores ingresos. Es una tienda que apenas le da para subsistir y, al estar delicada D. salud los últimos meses, ha visto decrecer sus ingresos pero sin rendirse, lo que resalta lo fuerte y perseverante D. su persona, quien también, como otra modalidad D. ingreso se dedicaba a vender menúes en su barrio pero su salud le impidió continuar paralelamente con dicha labor.

La señora Carmen necesita D. 700 soles para poder solventar la inversión en su tienda que, por campaña naviD.ña, suele incrementar la demanda y tuviera que comprar la mercadería necesaria para la venidera temporada.
texts.en:
Carmen is 56 years old and 5 years ago set up a small store when she sells groceries and beer, to mention what gives her the greatest income. The store barely gives her enough to live on and because she has been in poor health the past few months, she has seen her income fall. She has not given up though, which underlines what a strong and persistent personality she has. As another source of income she sold meals in her neighborhood, but her health issues prevent her from continuing with that work. Carmen needs a loan for 700 soles to pay for investment in her store because during Christmas demand increases and she needs to buy merchandise for the coming season.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Julia Estela

texts.es:
Habiendo vuelto al negocio de la venta de ropa por catálogo hace un año, la señora Julia, de 33 años, se dedicaba a la venta de zapatos pero, al ser muy caros los precios para el público, decidió dejarlo y enrumbarse hacia la venta de ropa, rubro en el que le va bien pero es consciente de que pudiera irle mucho mejor en caso de contar con más capital para la compra de la mercadería. la señora Julia sueña algún día con poder volver al negocio de zapatos para lo cual asegura contar ya con la adecuada cartera de clientes, consiguiendo así mucho más ingresos y, por ende, elevar su nivel de calidad de vida junto con su menor hijo y esposo.

Es por ello que requiere de un préstamo de 700 soles y poder comprar mercadería necesaria para la próxima temporada de estos meses y  emprender de ahora en adelante su vida, llena de juventud y ganas de crecer.
texts.en:
Having returned to the business of selling catalog clothing a year ago, Señora Julia, 33, used to sell shoes but, because the retail prices are very dear, she decided to change to selling clothing. This line is going well for her, but she is aware that it would go much better if she had more capital to buy merchandise. Señora Julia dreams of one day being able to return to the shoe business when she is sure of the adequate finances of her clients, with the much greater income that would result in raising her level of quality of life with her minor son and her husband. This is why she needs this loan of $250, to be able to buy the merchandise necessary for the next season, starting now to get ahead in life, full of youth and the desire to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for the future Christmas and summer seasons

loans.name: Nelly Ruth

texts.es:
Con años D. experiencia en la venta D. menúes para gente D. su barrio y uno que otro cliente esporádico, la señora Nelly junto con su familia han visto una gran oportunidad en la construcción D. cientos D. departamentos que se harán en su barrio, lo que incluye cientos D. trabajadores y es ahí donD. entraría a tallar el negocio D. la señora: está casi cerrado un contrato con los mismos ingenieros para abastecer D. almuerzos a gran parte D. los trabajadores en los próximos meses.


Teniendo que comprar tapers, insumos para la preparación D. sus comidas e implementar su cocina en sí y con ollas más grandes, es que requiere del préstamo D. 900 soles, algo que ansía junto con sus 3 menores hijos y esposo.
texts.en:
With years of experience in the sale of prix fixe meals for the people of her neighborhood and some sporadic clients, Señora Nelly and her family have found a great opportunity in the construction of hundreds of apartments that will be put up in their neighborhood, including hundreds of workers. This is where she started to build her business. She has almost concluded a contract with the engineers to supply lunches to the majority of the workers in the upcoming months. Having to buy candles, ingredients for the meals, plus putting together her kitchen with larger cookers, is why she needs this loan of $300, something she, her husband, and her 3 minor children are longing to do.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish setting up her kitchen and living room for dinner clients, plus meal ingredients

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Con recién 2 años D. haber puesto su bodega, no le es suficiente para poder mantener a sus 2 menores hijas, ambas en edad escolar, por lo que se las ha ingeniado para poner un puesto ambulante D. venta D. salchipapa y pollo broaster así como también reciclar distintos materiales para su posterior venta, todo este sacrificio lo hace sola y sólo para brindarle una adecuada educación a sus hijas.


Para ello necesita D. 1000 soles porque lo que le falta no son clientes sino los insumos que venD. y, con tan noble fin D. educar a sus hijas por sobre todas las cosas, es digna D. tomarla en cuenta.
texts.en:
Only two years after establishing her shop, she found it was not enough to support her two young daughters, both of whom are of school age. As a result, she has managed to establish a portable stall selling salchipapa (sausage) and fried chicken, as well as recycling different materials for resale. She makes all this sacrifice alone and only to proviD. an adequate education to her daughters.

For this, she needs 1,000 soles because what she lacks is not customers but products to sell. It is worth taking into account her goal of educating her daughters above everything. Con recién 2 años D. haber puesto su bodega, no le es suficiente para poder mantener a sus 2 menores hijas, ambas en edad escolar, por lo que se las ha ingeniado para poner un puesto ambulante D. venta D. salchipapa y pollo broaster así como también reciclar distintos materiales para su posterior venta, todo este sacrificio lo hace sola y sólo para brindarle una adecuada educación a sus hijas. Para ello necesita D. 1000 soles porque lo que le falta no son clientes sino los insumos que venD. y, con tan noble fin D. educar a sus hijas por sobre todas las cosas, es digna D. tomarla en cuenta.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock her shop and have capital for her other business: selling salchipapa and fried chicken.

loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.es:
Con casi 3 años D. puesto su local, la señora Norma, D. 52 años, expenD. ahí menúes y cervezas para sus comensales pero, inclusive con estos 2 ingresos, le es insuficiente para tamaña familia: su esposo, su hija, cuñado y 2 nietas, que son su fuerza, por lo que también recurre a una actividad mensual: vender pachamancas.

Ningún esfuerzo es digno D. sus nietas, D. su familia, por lo que la señora Norma sueña con terminar D. implementar el ambiente del local, en su propia casa, así como también hacerse D. más insumos para la preparación D. menúes y compra D. cervezas, para lo cual necesita D. 700 soles D. préstamo en aras D. poder brindarle una mejor calidad D. vida a su familia.
texts.en:
With almost 3 years in the same location, Señora Norma, 52, sells set-menu meals and beer to her clients, but these two incomes together are insufficient for the size of her family: her husband, daughter, brother-in-law and 2 nieces are her strength. Señora Norma dreams of completing the decoration of her business place as well as her own home, plus buying meal ingredients and beers, for which she needs this loan of $250, in order to proviD. her family with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete her business place where she sells meals and beer, plus purchasing meal ingredients and beers

loans.name: Bella María

texts.es:
De 42 años, la señora María tiene su bodega hace 15 años, siendo la primera en el barrio, aunque esto no ha sido sinónimo de mejores ingresos, por lo que ha tenido que idearse otros medios de ingreso como la venta de cosméticos por catálogo de una conocida marca en el medio. La gran meta de la señora María es sacar adelante a su hija menor hija que cursa la primaria en el colegio.

Para lo cual necesita un préstamo de 600 soles en aras de incrementar sus ingresos y poder brindarle la tan añorada buena educación a su menor hija.
texts.en:
At 42 years of age, María has owned her shop for 15 years. Being the first in her neighborhood has not been synonumous with better earnings. As a result, she has had to come up with other means of income, such as selling catalog cosmetics from a namebrand. María's greatest goal is to help her young daughter, who is in primary school, get ahead.

For this, she needs a loan of 600 soles in order to increase her income and provide the much -missed good education to her young daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Acquire the necessities for her shop, such as completing its construction, beer, as well as cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Irma Reyna

texts.es:
Como fundadora del barrio, la señora Irma cuenta con un gran respaldo y clientela en su comedor, se caracteriza por velar por sus hijos como pocas madres, por que no les falte nada, absolutamente nada y así es a pesar de la avanzada edad de 2 de ellos aunque la menor es su tesoro más grande, quiere darle lo mejor de lo mejor y, es así que, se dedica también al negocio naturista que implica viajes a provincias, contando con menor tiempo para su comedor pero se las ha ingeniado todos estos años organizándolo bien.

Para el techado de cemento de su comedor, en aras de cumplir las metas que se ha trasado como madre, es que requiere de un préstamo de 700 soles.
texts.en:
As a pillar of the neighborhood, Irma has much support and clientele for her eatery. She is known for watching over her children as few mothers do, so that they lack nothing, absolutely nothing. Since 2 are older, the youngest is now her greatest treasure, she wants to give her the best of the best. This is why she has her natural foods business, requiring trips into the provinces, leaving less time for her eatery. She has managed everything well all these years, organizing well. For a cement roof for her eatery and in order to accomplish what she has undertaken as a mother, she needs this loan of $250.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish construction of the interior of her house for her food clients, plus to stock up on necessities for her natural business requiring trips into the provinces

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.es:
Con 52 años y 25 de ellos vendiendo salchipapas, la señora Reynalda se sacrifica por sus hijos y nietos, todo es por y para ellos, cuenta con mucha experiencia y una fiel clientela, lo que le ha permitido ir creciendo de a pocos, lento pero seguro, logrando así casi terminar de cambiar el material noble por el adecuado para su casa, que la comparte con hijos y nietos.

Requiere de 500 soles de préstamo para poder lograr tan ansiada meta, trazada desde hacía 25 años, cuando empezó en un puesto ambulante situado fuera de su casa, que luce hoy en día distinta.
texts.en:
At 52, with 25 years spent selling salchipapas (sausage and fries), Señora Reynalda sacrifices herself for her children and grandchildren, everything is for them. She has plenty of experience and a faithful clientele, which has permitted her to keep growing little by little, slowly but surely. She has almost succeeded at finishing the house she shares with her children and grandchildren. She needs a loan of $175 in order to complete this long-desired task, envisioned 25 years ago, when she started in a mobile kiosk outside of her house, and now seeing the light of day.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction of her salchipapa business with a roof and floor

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Sary V. lives with her husband and their one child in the Phteah Rung Village of Pursat Province in Cambodia. She and her husband have been in the farming business since 2000. More specifically, they grow rice, and they currently earn approximately 10,000 Riel (US$2.50) per day.

Sary and her husband work extremely hard every day to generate income for the family's daily living expenses. For another source of income, Sary is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 Riel (US$250) to purchase piglets to breed. In this way, she is hoping that the loan will enable her to increase her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to breed as an additional source of income

loans.name: Phanna

texts.en:
Phanna C., 26, is a grocery seller in Prek Sdey Village in the Pursat Province and has been selling for one year. Phanna is married to Das Sophea and has two children, who are small, young and attend school. Her husband is a fish seller by transporting to customers' homes.

To fulfill her customers' requirements and to increase income, Phanna would like to request a loan of US$500 to purchase more grocery inventory to sell. For another source of income, she has purchased piglets to breed. For her future plans, Phanna wants to own a large store to stock all kinds of products to sell, and to support her children to graduate and get good jobs.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery inventory to sell.

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Soeurn S., 41, is farmer who grows rice in the Phteah Rung Village of PurS. Province in Cambodia. He has a great deal of experience in the rice-growing business because he has been doing so since 1988. Currently, he can earn approximately 8,000 Riel (US$2.00) per day. He lives with his wife and their three children, all of whom are in school.

Normally, Cambodian people will use an ox or buffalo as labor for plowing farmland. Because he only has one ox to help with his farming operation, Soeurn is seeking a loan in the amount of 500,000 Riel (US$125) to purchase another ox to match with his existing one in order to plow his farmland in a more efficient manner.

loans.use: To improve his farming operation by purchasing another ox in order to plow the farmland

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To start a small business selling costume jewelry

loans.name: Oit

texts.en:
Oit D. is 45 years old and has bred pigs for sale since 2000, earning about $3.20 per day. Oit is married to Mr. Ul Bun, 46, a rice farmer and mill owner offering grinding services. They have five children, one of whom works in a shopping center earning around $110 per month and helping to support the family.

To increase income, Oit is requesting a loan to purchase both pig feed and more pigs to breed.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs to breed as will as pig food.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase crockery, window curtains and other goods for a small business.

loans.name: Ashuqullah

texts.en:
Ashuqullah is a young man aged 25 years old. He has studied up to ninth class and is currently studying English classes. In his spare time, he started a small business selling medicines. He opened a drugstore in his village in Jalalabad city, Nangarhar province. Ashuqullah lives with his two sisters and his old mother in a small house in the village. His father is dead.

Ashuqullah plans to make a small clinic in his village in the future. He has contacted Kiva for a 50000 (AF) individual loan for 18 months to buy some different medicines and syrups for his drugstore. He also has his own capital of 8000 (AF) ($160) which he has invested into the shop. He thanks Kiva and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy medicines and syrups

loans.name: Rohullamen

texts.en:
This man is Rohullamen, 33 years old and married. He lives Jalalabad city, Nangarhar province. He graduated from 12th class two years ago. He is a hard worker but because of some financial problems he cannot study anymore. So he started a small business as a retailer in the Khewa and he supports the whole household.

Rohullamen has one sister and two brothers. He lives with his parents in a rental house. Their lives are going well but there is a problem for Rohllamen with capital. He has just 10,000(AF) or US$ 200 and he wants to increase his income because their expenditures are too much. He wants his brothers and sister to obtain higher education so that they can help our country and the country's people in the future.

For that reason, Rohullamen wants to take 50,000(AF) as an individual loan from AFSG with a term of 18 months so he can buy some things like oil, rice, notebooks, milk, pens, etc. for his shop. And he will pay this money back on time. He thanks all those who make individual loans to Kiva borrowers possible.

loans.use: buying oil, rice, milk, etc.

loans.name: Fazalraman

texts.en:
Fazalraman is an educated man with full experience. He has a retail shop where he works. It is a long time that he has been working in this business. He has some good numbers of customers. He has a small business but when he got his first cycle loan he completed his stock, then he continued his business with more success and still he is working.

Now he has requested a second-cycle loan to enlarge his shop and involve one of his sons in this business. Therefore, he wants to work hard to make a better future for all his family, specially for the son who works with Fazalraman. He is sure that he can further his business with more success.

Finally, he would like to thank those who helped him by granting him his first loan and also those who will help him in this second-cycle loan. He is happy with this process of loans in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To enlarge his shop

loans.name: Mena

texts.en:
Mena is the mother of 3 children who lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She has a pottery business. She has been involved in this business for a long time. She is a hard worker and a talented woman. She makes clay bowls and her husband sells them in the bazzar. She got her first-cycle loan and furthered her business with more success. With the income from the first loan, she was able to open a retail shop for her husband.

Now she has requested her second-cycle loan to complete his stock and also further her own business so that she can find an opportunity to enlarge her husband's business and continue her business with more success.

Mena is happy. She would like to say that before she received her first-cycle loan, she was really very weak in her business. After that she was able to open a retail shop for her husband, so she would like to thank those that helped her already and those who will help her now in this process. And also she would like to thank Kiva and AFSG for making this process available to people like her.

loans.use: To complete her husband's stock

loans.name: Mohammad Smail

texts.en:
M. Smail lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and he has a retail shop. When he started this business for the first time, he had a small business and he was very weak, but when he got an individual loan he really improved a lot in his business and still he is furthering his business, attracting some good numbers of customers, making a good income for his family, and repaying the loan without any difficulty and on time.

Therefore he has requested his second-cycle loan to enlarge his shop and continue his business with even more success. He is sure that he can be a good business dealer in the future.

He is happy with this loan. He would like to thank both Kiva and AFSG and all lenders around the world who help workers and people who would like to be strong in their businesses. Finally, he wants to say that this process is a successful one in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To enlarge his shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in women's pants in order to move her small business forward.

loans.name: Comlanvi Mathias

texts.fr: Né en 1966 à Aklakou, Monsieur A. Comlanvi Mathias est un revendeur très dynamique ayant le sens de l’entreprenariat. C'est un conducteur de btaxi moto, marié et père de 5 enfants. Pour répondre aux besoins sans cesse croissants de ceux-ci, il décide d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire grâce à l’achat d'une nouvelle moto pour le transport. Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions et niveau de vie de ses enfants et de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1966 in Aklakou, Mr. Comlanvi Mathias A. is a very energetic retailer with an entrepreneurial sense. A motorbike taxi driver, he is married and has five children. To meet their ever-growing needs, he decided to raise his level of business through the purchase of a new motorbike for transportation. It will enable him to improve his situation and the standard of living of his children and family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a moto taxi

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Née à Afagnan en 1985, A. Ablavi est une jeune femme célibataire. Instruite de niveau primaire, elle a cessé l’école pour apprendre la couture. Aujourd’hui elle n'arrive pas à exercer cette activité mais s'est lancée dans le commerce de céréales qu’elle a hérité de sa mère. Elle achète le maïs en période d’abondance et le revend dans le temps de soudure. Les bénéfices de cette activité très rentable lui serviront à augmenter ses revenus et à mieux subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Born in 1985 in Afagnan, Ms. Ablavi A. is a young unmarried woman. Educated through primary school, she dropped out to learn how to sew. As the manager of a seamstress shop today, she wants to reconcile this aptitude, which she inherited from her mother, with commerce. She wants to buy corn while it is abundant now and to resell it when it is scare. This being a very gainful business, the profits will let her provide for her family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking and selling corn

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Monsieur G. Komi, est né le 28 Novembre 1987 à Agoè-Nyivé (Lomé). Instruit de niveau secondaire, il raccrocha très tôt les études pour céder à sa passion de commerce. Devenu ainsi un commerçant, il gère un établissement qu’il a co-ouvert avec sa sœur. Aujourd’hui ayant détaché son activité, il cherche un financement pour acheter et vendre des fournitures scolaires aux élèves de sa localité. Les bénéfices lui serviront d’étendre le cadre de son activité.
texts.en:
Mr.Komi G. was born on November 28,1987 in Agoè-Nyivé (Lomé). Having a secondary school education, he hung up his bookbag very early on in order to submit to his passion for commerce. Having thus become a merchant, he manages an establishment that he and his sister opened. Today, having let loose his work, he is seeking financing for doing commerce in school supplies for pupils in his town. The profits will serve to expand the scope of his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell school supplies

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.fr: Madame K. Sylvie est née en 1979 à Attiémé. Elle vit actuellement avec ses 2 enfants en charge à Afagnan. Instruite de niveau primaire, elle a vite cerné les rouages de son commerce. Elle achète les produits de première nécessité notamment les savons, les détergeants, du lait et autres à Lomé et les revend à Afagnan. Elle a besoin de financement pour augmenter la taille de son commerce et mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Les bénéfices lui serviront à améliorer les conditions de vie des personnes à sa charge sur le plan scolaire, alimentaire et sanitaire.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sylvie K. was born in 1979 in Attiémé. She presently lives with her two children in Afagnan. She attended primary school, but quickly stepped out into the business world. She buys staples, especially soap, detergent, milk and other goods, in Lomé and re-sells them in Afagnan.

Sylvie needs a loan to expand the size of her business and better satisfy her clientele. She will use the profit to improve living conditions, from the standpoint of food and health concerns, for the children for whom she is the breadwinner and also to pay school fees.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of staple goods

loans.name: Mawoulé

texts.fr: Né à Agbétsiko en Juillet 1976, Monsieur M. Mawoulé vit aujourd’hui avec sa femme et ses deux enfants à Afagnan. Enseignant de profession, il a décidé d’associer le travail de cafétéria très tôt les matins et les soirs pour soutenir son revenu. Un financement lui permettra de se ravitailler afin d’être à la hauteur des demandes de sa clientèle. Des bénéfices, il parviendra à étendre son cadre d’activité et à bien subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in Agbétsiko in July 1976, Mr. Mawoulé M. now lives with his wife and his two children in Afagnan. A teacher by profession, he decided, on the side, to open a cafeteria very early mornings and evenings to supplement his earnings. A loan will allow him to build up his inventory of foodstuffs so as not to disappoint his clientele. From the profit, he will be able to expand this business and take good care of his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stocking his cafeteria

loans.name: Agbo Komi

texts.fr: Agé de 30 ans, Monsieur B. Agbo Komi est demeurant à Amégnran, son village natal. Marié et père de 2 enfants, il est mécanicien de profession, métier qu’il exerce avec passion. Cependant, la cherté actuelle de la vie ne lui permet pas de joindre les deux bouts. Diversifier ses sources de revenu est pour lui une solution afin de contrecarrer la baisse du pourvoir d’achat. Il veut acheter une moto qu’il mettra en circulation pour transport. Ceci va augmenter son revenu et l’aider à mieux faire face à ses problèmes de famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Agbo Komi B., age 30, lives in Amégnran, his native village. Married and the father of two, he is a mechanic by trade, work he does with passion. Yet the high cost of living these days prevents him from making ends meet. Diversifying his sources of income is one solution for him, in order to thwart the drop in buying power. He wants to buy a motorbike that he will put to use in the transport business. This will increase his income and help him address his family problems better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a moto taxi

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Monsieur H. Koffi est né en 1981 à Kini-Kondji dans la préfecture de Yoto. Aujourd’hui demeurant à Katihoé, il est marié et père de 2 enfants. Sa passion pour le commerce l’a amené à abandonner ses études et ouvrir une boutique d'alimentation générale. Il est très reconnu dans le milieu. Mais son principal handicap reste le manque de fond de roulement pour ravitailler sa boutique en produits alimentaires et divers afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter son revenu et améliorer la qualité de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Koffi H. was born in 1981 in Kini-Kondji, in Yoto Prefecture. Nowadays, he is staying in Katihoé and is married with two children. His passion for commerce has lead him to abandon school and to open a grocery store. He is well-recognized in the area. But his main handicap remains the lack of working capital for supplying his store with food items and various goods, so that he may satisfy his customers better. Having the capital would enable him to increase his income and to improve his family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply his shop with grocery items

loans.name: Djolévi

texts.fr: Madame A. Djolévi est née en 1967 à Gbavé (P/Lacs), mariée à un chauffeur, elle vit aujourd’hui à Amégnran avec ses 3 enfants. C’est une dame qui est très reconnue dans son entourage de par son activité. En effet, elle fait le commerce de céréales comme le maïs, haricot et mil. Cependant les charges du ménage ne lui permettent pas de jouir de ses profits. Son ambition est d’agrandir son commerce afin d’en profiter plus. Pour cela elle sollicite un financement.
texts.en:
Ms. Djolévi A. was born in 1967 in Gbavé (Lacs Prefecture). She is married to a driver and nowadays lives in Amégnran with her three children. This is a woman who is recognized among her friends and family for her work, which is in fact commerce in grains, such as corn, beans, and millet. Yet household expenses don't allow her to enjoy a profit. Her ambition is to grow her business to take better advantage of it. To do so, she is requesting financing.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock and sell grain

loans.name: Ayika

texts.fr: Ne le 31 décembre 1979 à Djrékpo-Hagou, Monsieur T. Ayika vit actuellement dans le même village où il exerce ses activités. Marié et père de famille, il est spécialiste de maintenance. A cela, il a ajouté la vente de portables, d’ordinateurs et accessoires. Grâce à cela, il arrive à subvenir aux besoins des huit personnes à sa charge. Il est à la recherche d’un financement pour renforcer son activité surtout avec la création d’autres points de vente.
texts.en:
Born December 31, 1979, in Djrékpo-Hagou, Ayika T. currently lives in the same town from which he operates his business. Married and a father, his specialty is doing repairs. In addition, he sells laptops, desktop computers and accessories. Thanks to this business, he manages to see to the needs of the eight people in his care. He is seeking financing to expand his business, primarily by opening up additional sales outlets.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of laptops and accessories

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Né en 1985 à Amégnran dans la préfecture de Vo, Monsieur H. Koffi vit dans le même village où il exerce ses activités. Quoique célibataire, il a à sa charge 5 petits frères. Pour faire face à ces charges, il s’adonne à la vente des produits de la médecine traditionnelle. Très soucieux de son avenir et celui de ses frères, il manque de moyen pour redynamiser son activité en vue de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. C'est pour cela qu'il sollicite un financement pour promouvoir son activité et accroitre ses revenus.
texts.en:
Born in 1985 in Amégnran (Vo Prefecture), Mr. Koffi H. lives in the same village where he works. Although unmarried, he has five younger brothers in his care. To cope with this responsibility, he devotes himself to the sale of traditional medicines. Very concerned about his future and that of his brothers, he lacks the means to re-energize his business with the goal of satisfying his customers. This is why he is requesting financing to advance his work and to grow his revenues.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell traditional medical remedies

loans.name: Kodjo Eric

texts.fr: Né le 22 novembre 1982 à Vogan, Monsieur A. Kodjo Eric est un jeune très dévoué qui réside aujourd’hui à Amégnran. Chauffeur de profession, il n’a pas encore une voiture à sa disposition. Ne pouvant pas rester les bras croisés, il s’est donné à la conduite de moto taxi. Il se débrouille avec le revenu qu’il tire de cette activité pour subvenir à ses besoins les plus élémentaires. Pour accroître son revenu, il veut s’acheter une moto qu’il mettra en circulation pour le transport des passagers.
texts.en:
Born on November 22, 1982 in Vogan, Mr. Kodjo Eric A. is a very devoted young man who today resides in Amégnran. A chauffeur by profession, he still lacks a car for his use. Unable to sit idly by, he has dedicated himself to driving a motorbike taxi. He manages to do OK on his own with the income derived from his work for meeting his most elementary needs. To grow his revenues, he wants to purchase a motorbike that he will put into use to transport travelers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a moto taxi

loans.name: Gnotouzin

texts.fr: Madame  Madame A. Gnotouzin est née en 1968 à Amégnran. Mariée et mère de 4 enfants, elle vit aujourd’hui à cheval entre Cotonou et Amégnran et exerce ses activités commerciales. Rompue à la tâche, elle est très mobile et commercialise le maïs, le haricot et les épices. Elle s’en sort avec cette activité mais se confronte de temps en temps à des manques de fonds de roulement ; ce qui entrave par moment l’évolution de son activité. C'est pourquoi elle sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son commerce.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gnotouzin A. was born in 1968 in Amégnran. Married and the mother of 4 children, she now lives in between Cotonou and Amégnran while working at her business. She is very mobile and sells corn (maize), dried beans, and spices. She manages to get by with this business but from time to time she experiences a lack of working capital which can have a negative effect on the evolution of her business. This is the reason why she is requesting a loan to bolster her little business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stocking and selling cereals

loans.name: Messan

texts.fr: Né en 1980 dans le village d’Amégnran, Monsieur A. Messan réside actuellement dans le même village avec sa famille. Il est marié et père de 2 enfants. Ayant abandonné très tôt ses études, il a appris la conduite, métier qu’il exerce avec passion. Avec le souci d’avoir son propre véhicule pour pouvoir réaliser plus d’économie, il sollicite un financement. Les revenus tirés lui permettront de mieux s’occuper des besoins de sa famille avec une amélioration des conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Born in 1980 in the village of Amégnran, Mr. Messan A. presently still lives in that same village with his family. He is married and the father of 2 children. Having left off his studies very early, he learned to drive, work he performs with passion. Intent of having his own car to use as a taxi so as to be able to save more, he is requesting a loan. The earnings he will make will allow him to better support his family and improve their living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a taxi

loans.name: Kpohoenou

texts.fr: Né en 1979 à Momé-Hagou, Monsieur H. Kpohoenou vit actuellement à Amégnran où il exerce son métier de photographe. Très entreprenant et actif, il a réussit à se procurer des appareils de qualité qui lui permettent de réaliser de bonnes prestation à ses clients. Cependant, les revenus tirés de son métier ne lui permettent pas d’assurer le nécessaire à sa famille. Ainsi, il veut diversifier ses sources de revenu en achetant une moto qu’il mettra en circulation pour le transport en commun.
texts.en:
Born in 1979 in Momé-Hagou, Mr. Kpohoenou H. currently lives in Amégnran, where he practices his trade as a photographer. A very entrepreneurial and active man, he succeeded in procuring quality cameras, which enable him to serve his clients well. Yet the income derived from his work doesn't permit him to ensure what is necessary for his family. And so, he wants to diversify his sources of income by buying a motorbike that he will put to use as a taxi.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a moto taxi

loans.name: Brada

texts.fr: Agée de 39 ans, Madame W. Brada réside aujourd’hui dans le village d’Amégnran où elle exerce ses activités génératrices de revenu. Mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle est couturière de profession. Parallèlement à la couture, elle est spécialisée dans la préparation et la vente de jus de fruit, activité qui lui est très rentable. Mais avec l’endommagement de son congélateur, cette activité a cessé et elle est donc sevrée de ses revenus. Elle compte acheter un nouveau congélateur mais les moyens lui manquent. Elle sollicite donc un crédit à cette fin.
texts.en:
Mrs. Brada W., 39, now lives in the village of Amégnran where she has her business. Married and the mother of 3 children, she is a professional seamstress. Besides sewing, she is specialized in the preparation and sale of fruit juice, which is very lucrative for her. With her freezer's break-down, however, she has had to stop this business and is missing the earnings from it. She would like to buy a new freezer but she does no have enough funds. She is asking for a loan for this purpose.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a freezer

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Madame A. Abla est née en 1977 à Lomé. Mariée et mère de 2 enfants, elle vit auprès de son mari à Amégnran où elle exerce sa profession de coiffeuse. En plus de la coiffure, elle fait le petit commerce surtout le stockage de céréales. Pour cette saison, elle compte faire plus de stockage de céréales afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et plus rentabiliser son activité. C'est à cette fin qu'elle sollicite un crédit.
texts.en:
Abla A. was born in Lomé in 1977. Married and the mother of two children, she lives with her husband in Amégnran where she works as a hairdresser. In addition to fixing hair, she does a small trade in cereal grains. At this time, Able intends to increase her inventory of cereal grains to better meet customer demand and make her business show a profit. With these goals in mind, she is requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking and selling cereal grains

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Monsieur H. Kodjo est né en 1965 dans le village de Dagbati et demeure actuellement à Amégnran. Journaliste à la station radio de la place, il est marié et père de 2 enfants. Pour permettre à sa famille de vivre décemment, il mène des activités parallèles comme le petit commerce. En cette période d’abondance de maïs, il désir faire un stockage consistant pour revendre en période de soudure. Pour cela il sollicite un financement pour faire le stockage et la vente de mais.
texts.en:
Mr. Kodjo H. was born in 1965 in the village of Dagbat and is currently staying in Amégnran. A journalist at the local radio station, he is married and the father of two. To allow his family a decent living, he does other work concurrently, such as small-scale commerce. Corn is plentiful now, and he would like to stock a major inventory for resale in lean times. To do so, he is requesting financing for stocking and selling corn.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock and sell corn

loans.name: Pamphile

texts.fr: Né en 1969 à Abomey dans le Bénin, Monsieur Pamphile L. vit actuellement à Afagnan avec sa femme et ses enfants. Il compte à sa charge un total de 10 personnes. La soudure à l'arc est son activité de tous les jours. Maître de 2 ateliers, il exerce cette activité depuis près de 20 ans. Son ambition est d'avoir un crédit pour renforcer ses 2 ateliers en achetant les barres de fer et les transformer en portail, en sceau métallique, moule et autres sur lesquels il gagne plus de bénéfices. Ceci lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in 1969 in Abomey in Bénin, Mr. Pamphile L. presently lives in Afagnan with his wife and his children. He is responsible for 10 people in all. Arc welding is his daily business. The owner of two workshops, he has been doing this work for almost 20 years. His ambition is to have a loan to bolster his two workshops by buying bars of iron to transform into gates, metal pails, molds and such items on which he earns a good profit. This will allow him to better provide for his family's needs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of raw materials for his welding workshops

loans.name: Démagnan

texts.fr: Monsieur S. A. Démagnan est né le 14 août 1977 à Afagnan. Marié et père de 4 enfants, il a préféré laisser sa profession de maintenance pour investir dans le commerce. Devenu une référence à Afagnan en matière de vente de cartes de recharges pour mobiles, il a voulu obtenir de l’agrément pour mieux vendre les cartes. Cette extension du champ de vente lui permettra de dégager de bénéfices qui lui serviront de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille notamment en matière de scolarité. C'est donc pour atteindre cet objectif qu'il sollicite un financement.
texts.en:
Mr. Démagnan A. S. was born on August 14, 1977 in Afagnan. Married and the father of four children, he chose to leave his work in maintenance to set up a shop. He has since become a reference point in Afagnan as far as sales of rechargeable cell phone cards are concerned, but he would like to obtain an agreement so as to be better placed to sell the cards. This expansion of his sales will allow him to make more profit, money he will use to support his family, and especially to pay school-related expenses. This is his goal in requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of rechargeable cell phone cards

loans.name: Omer

texts.fr: Monsieur D. K. Omer est un jeune homme marié et père de 2 enfants. Il est né à Afagnan en 1969 où il réside encore. Mécanographe de profession, il associe à son travail l’activité de photocopie. Connaissant bien les recettes qui sortent de cette activité, Monsieur D. Omer veut acheter un nouveau photocopieur par un financement afin de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. Les bénéfices lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux nombreux besoins de sa famille notamment sur les plans sanitaire, alimentaire, scolaire et professionnel.
texts.en:
Mr. Omer K. D. is a young married man, father of 2 children. He was born in Afagnan in 1969 and he lives there still. Computer operator by profession, he also offers photocopy services. Since he is well aware of the remunerative nature of this business, Mr. D. wants to buy a new photocopier with this loan, in order to better satisfy the needs of his clientele. The profit will allow him to better cater for the numerous needs of his family, especially those concerning health, food, schooling and professional training.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a photocopier

loans.name: Husna

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 38-year-old Husna K. from Mwanza. She is divorced and has four children between the ages of 10 and 18. Husna has been selling charcoal since 2005. She works at the business 12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by her children. Husna currently earns about $100 USD per month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $450 USD to buy more charcoal. In the future, she plans to increase the stock and also to open new business. Husna thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Ester T. from Mwanza, who is married with three children between the ages of 2 and 14. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because they are orphans. Ester has been running a pharmacy business since 2000. Working at the business 12 hours per day, 6 days per week, and assisted by her husband, she currently earns about $200 per month.

Ester is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy more medicine including anti-malaria drugs, panadol, shestcof, and mucolyn. In the future, she plans to open new a business. Ester thanks you for her support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more medicines for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 36-year-old Irene A. from Mwanza. She is married and has five children between the ages of 7 and 20. She also supports another dependant because he is an orphan. Irene has been running a tailoring business since 1995. She works 12 hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by her husband. Irene currently earns about $100 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD to buy more cloth. In the future, she plans to open a new business. Irene thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr:
Mme D. Eya est née en 1972 à Bégbé dans la Préfecture du Zio au Togo. Elle mariée à un chauffeur avec lequel ils ont eu trois (03) enfants. Pour aider son mari à faire face aux charges de la famille, elle s’est lancée dans l’agriculture, notamment dans la culture du mais, un secteur très prometteur dans la région.
Pour augmenter son rendement agricole et ses revenus, elle sollicite un financement pour acheter des fertilisants et augmenter sa surface cultivable.
texts.en:
Ms. Eya D. was born in 1972 in Bégbé in Zio Prefecture, Togo. She is married to a chauffeur, and together they have three children. To assist her husband in addressing family expenses, she got started in agriculture, notably in growing corn, a very promising sector in the region. To increase her harvest and her income, she is requesting financing to buy fertilizer and to increase her arable terrain.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to enrich the soil

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en: Haider, 39, is married and has three children. He lives in Beirut, the capitA. of Lebanon. Haidar owns a automotive repair business, and he has asked A. Majmoua for a loan of $1000 USD to purchase a compressor for painting cars. In the past he has rented a compressor from his neighbors but this is very expensive. By purchasing his own compressor, he can increase his profit by 50 percent.

loans.use: To buy a compressor

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Née le 03 Avril 1945 à Bégbé dans le Zio, Mme Abra A. est une veuve très dynamique avec trois (03) enfants à charge. Son activité principale est la préparation et la vente de denrées alimentaires dans son village. Pour faire face à la demande et à l’exigence de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un crédit pour aménager un bon cadre sous forme de restaurant et s’approvisionner en riz et mais. Ce financement lui permettra de rentabiliser son activité et de s’occuper de l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Born on April 3, 1945 in Bégbé (Zio Prefecture), Ms. Abra A. is a very dynamic widow with three children in her care. Her main work is making and selling food in her village. To address the demand and the expectations of her customers, she is requesting a loan for fitting up a nice place as a restaurant and to get supplies of rice and corn. This financing will enable her to be profitable and to take care of the education of her children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix up a restaurant and for supplies

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en: Hanan is the mother of one child and lives in Beirut. She is 24 years old and owns a small shop that specializes in selling lingerie. Hanan has requested a loan of $500 USD from Al Majmoua to purchase more products for her shop. She believes that it is very important to have variety of styles and colors for her clients to choose from, and is confident that this loan will allow her to expand her clientele and increase her profits.

loans.use: To diversify her clothing stock.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Mme Ama F. est une femme agricultrice née en 1970 à Kpévégo au Sud du Togo. Elle est mariée également à un agriculteur et est mère de six (06) enfants. Elle cultive du mais qu’elle revend sur le marché en période de hausse de prix. Pour augmenter son rendement et accroître ses revenus, elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter les intrants et augmenter sa surface cultivable.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ama F. is a farmer who was born in 1970 in Kpévégo in the south of Togo. She is married to a farmer as well, and she is the mother of 6 children. She grows corn which she sells in the marketplace when prices are high. To increase her harvest and her earnings, she is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs and to expand the surface she cultivates.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of agricultural inputs and expansion of surface under cultivation

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Mme Akouvi A. une femme cultivatrice d’une quarantaine d’année avec deux (02) enfants à charge. Son activité est la culture de mais et de manioc. Cette activité lui permet d’aider son mari à faire face aux dépenses familiales et à la scolarisation de leurs enfants. C’est pourquoi elle sollicite un financement pour acheter des engrais en vue d’accroître ses rendements.
texts.en:
Mrs. Akouvi A., a farmer of about 40 who is raising 2 children, grows maize and manioc. This business permits her to help her husband meet the family living expenses and pay the school fees for their children. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer in order to expand her harvests.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Maysa

texts.en: Maysa is 27 years old and owns a small mobile phone shop in Beirut. She has requested a loan of $800 from A. Majmoua to purchase a new supply of modern cellular phones and accessories. Maysa is a shrewd businesswoman and is confident that this loan will allow her to effectively diversify her product offerings, and by so doing, attract a broader range of clients. Maysa is grateful for the opportunity provided to her by Kiva and A. Majmoua.

loans.use: To purchase a new stock of mobile phones for Maysaa's shop.

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr: Née en 1970 à Bégbé dans la  Préfecture de Zio au sud du Togo, Mme Adzo A. est une femme célibataire avec quatre (04) enfants à charge. Pour faire face seule à la scolarisation des ses enfants, elle s’adonne à l’agriculture notamment la culture de mais. Elle sollicite pour cela un financement pour acheter des engrais en vue d’accroître ses récoltes et ses revenus.
texts.en:
Born in 1970 in Bégbé (Zio Prefecture) in the south of Togo, Ms. Adzo A. is an unmarried woman with four children in her care. To cope by herself with the schooling of her children, she dedicates herself to agriculture, notably growing corn. Thus, she is requesting financing to buy fertilizer with the intent of increasing her harvest and her income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Mme Adjo A. est née en 1973 à Adangbé  dans la Préfecture du Zio au sud du Togo. Elle mariée à un agriculteur avec lequel ils ont eu trois (03) enfants. Pour aider son mari à faire face aux charges familiales, elle s’est lancée dans l’agriculture, notamment dans la culture du mais, un secteur très prometteur dans la région.
Pour augmenter son rendement agricole et ses revenus, elle sollicite un financement pour acheter des fertilisants et augmenter sa surface cultivable.
texts.en:
Ms. Adjo A. was born in 1973 in Adangbé (Zio Prefecture) in the south of Togo. She is married to a grower, and together they have three children. To help her husband address family expenses, she got started in agriculture, notably growing corn, a highly promising sector in the region. To increase her harvest and her income, she is requesting financing to buy fertilizers and to expand her arable terrain.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and to expand her arable land

loans.name: Déla

texts.fr: Mme Déla K. est née en 1976 à Kpévégo au sud du Togo  Elle mariée a un cultivateur avec lequel elle a eu (5) enfants  pour aider son marie à subvenir aux charges de la famille, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce notamment dans la vente des denrées  alimentaires. Elle sollicite un financement pour s’approvisionner en marchandise et augmenter son revenu.
texts.en:
Ms. Déla K. was born in 1976 in Kpévégo, in the south of Togo. She is married to a grower, with whom she has five children. To assist her husband in providing for the family, she got started in commerce, notably in selling grocery items. She is requesting financing to get supplies of merchandise and to increase her income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supplies of goods

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mme Afi K.  est née en 1968 à Vogan  dans la Préfecture de Vo  au sud .Est du Togo. Elle est veuve  avec  cinq (05) enfants. Pour faire face aux charges familiales, elle s’est lancée dans l’agriculture, notamment dans la culture du mais, un secteur très prometteur dans la région. Pour augmenter son rendement elle sollicite  un financement pour acheter de l’engrais. Ce financement lui permettra  d’agrandir sa surface cultivable et l’amélioration de sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Afi K. was born in 1968 in Vogan in Vo Prefecture, southeast of Togo. She is a widow with five children. To discharge her family responsibilities, she went into agriculture, specifically into raising corn, a very promising sector in the region. To increase her yield, Afi is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer. This funding will enable her to increase the amount of land she has under cultivation and to improve her way of life.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and additives

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 51 years old, married, and has 3 children. He lives in Beirut and bakes "Manniesh" bread for local bakeries and street vendors to re-sell. Manniesh is a traditional type of Lebanese bread which is usually topped with Zaater- a thyme-like herb, and cheese or minced meat. It can be found in the hands of nearly every Lebanese for either breakfast or lunch. The tasty bread is almost always served warm, and Mohammed supplies locals with soft, fresh Manniesh every day.

Mohammed has asked Al Majmoua for a loan of 500 US Dollars in order to repair his bread oven and many of his aging tools. Mohammed is grateful for the opportunity provided to him by Kiva and Al Majmoua, and he is confident that this loan will enable him to sustain his business and continue to support his family.

loans.use: to repair Mohammed's bread oven and many of his tools

loans.name: Kuya

texts.fr:
Mariée à un cultivateur, Mme Kuya D. est née en 1958 au Ghana. N’ayant reçu aucune formation, elle s’est également engagée dans l’agriculture à travers la culture du mais qu’elle produit et revend sur le marché. Cette activité lui permet de soutenir son mari financièrement. 
Pour augmenter son rendement, elle sollicite un financement pour l’achat d’intrants notamment les engrais et les semences.
texts.en:
Ms. Kuya D. was born in Ghana in 1958 and is married to a grower. Not having received any training at all, she has dedicated herself as well to agriculture through the growing of corn, which she produces and then sells on the market. This work enables her to support her husband financially. To increase her yield, she is requesting financing to buy supplies, notaly manure and seeds.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Née en 1971 à Kpévégo dans la Préfecture du  Zio au sud du Togo, Mme Afi B. est mariée à un mécanicien avec deux (02) enfants à charge. Son activité principale est la préparation et la vente de denrées alimentaires dans son village. Pour faire face à la demande et à l’exigence de ses consommateurs, elle sollicite un crédit pour aménager un bon cadre sous forme de restaurant et s’approvisionner en riz et mais. Ce financement lui permettra de rentabiliser son activité et de s’occuper de l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Born in 1971 in Kpévégo in southern Togo (Zio Prefecture), Afi B. is married to a mechanic and has two children in her care. Her primary occupation is the preparation and sale of food products in her village. To meet customer demand and the expectations of her clients, Afi is requesting a loan to turn a good location into a restaurant, and to stock up on rice and corn. This funding would enable her to show a profit from her business and to attend to her children’s education.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Setting up a restaurant and purchasing provisions

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi Z. est née en 1984 à Bégbé. Célibataire avec trois (03) enfants à charge,  elle pratique l’agriculture, la culture du mais, la seule activité génératrice de revenu dans son milieu. Elle sollicite un financement pour acheter des intrants agricoles et augmenter sa surface cultivable. Ce crédit lui permettra d’accroître conséquemment ses revenus et de faire face à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Afi Z. was born in 1984 in Bégbé. She is single raising 3 children, and she farms, growing maize, the only way to earn money in her area. She is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs and increase the area she has under cultivation. This loan will allow her to increase her earnings and provide school-fees for her children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of agricultural inputs and increase of area under cultivation

loans.name: Habib

texts.en: Habib, 44, lives in Beirut and owns a mini-market that caters to his local neighbors. Habib has requested a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua to purchase a large stock of items for his shop. This will be Habib's second loan with Al Majmoua. His first was repaid in full and on time.

loans.use: To purchase a new stock

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Agée de 48 ans, Mme Afi D. est une veuve ayant quatre (04) enfants à sa charge. Après le décès de son mari, elle continua l’activité commune qu’elle menait avec ce dernier, c'est-à-dire la culture du mais pour subvenir aux dépenses scolaires de ses enfants et de sa famille. 
Elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter des engrais et accroître sa surface cultivable.
texts.en:
48-year-old Afi D. is a widow with four children in her care. In order to pay for her children’s schooling and to support her family, after her husband passed away, she continued the business they had had together, raising corn. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and to increase the amount of land she has under cultivation.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and to increase amount of land under cultivation

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mme Afi A.  est née en 1970 au Ghana. Elle est mariée et mère de cinq (05) enfants. Pour faire face aux charges familiales aux cotés de son mari, elle s’est lancée dans l’agriculture, notamment dans la culture du mais, un secteur très prometteur dans la région. Pour augmenter son rendement elle sollicite  un financement pour acheter de l’engrais. Ce financement lui permettra  d’agrandir sa surface cultivable et l’amélioration de sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Afi A. was born in 1970 in Ghana. She is married and the mother of five children. In order to shoulder family responsibilities alongside her husband, she went into agriculture, into raising corn in particular, a very promising sector in the region. Afi is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer in order to increase her yield. This funding would enable her to expand the amount of land she has under cultivation and to improve her way of life.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of agricultural additives

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants, Mme Afi N. est née en 1983 à Bégbé dans le Zio au sud du Togo. N’ayant reçu aucune formation, elle s’est également engagée dans l’agriculture à travers la culture du mais qu’elle produit et revend sur le marché. Cette activité lui permet de soutenir son mari financièrement. Le sol devenant de plus en plus pauvre, pour augmenter son rendement, elle sollicite un financement pour l’achat d’intrants notamment les engrais et les semences.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of 4 children, Mrs. Afi N. was born in 1983 in Bégbé in the Zio area in the south of Togo. Having received no formal training, she farms maize which she sells in the marketplace. This work allows her to help her husband with family expenses. Her land becoming ever less fertile, however, she is requesting a loan to increase her harvest through inputs to her soil, notably fertilizer, and improved seed.
