This business brings her just enough income to support her two children. Arzadi is married, however because her husband is unemployed, she has to work more to improve their quality of life. Currently, she plans to obtain a 12-month loan in order to increase goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnover

loans.name: Yung

texts.en:
Mrs. Yung S., 33, is married and lives with her husband and three children, aged 13, 7, and 3, in Bathambong province, Cambodia. To make a living, Yung S. buys garlic from a broker and then re-sells it to people in her community. She earns about US$2 per day in profit, while her husband can make, on average, US$3 per day working as a motor-taxi driver. 
Yung S. started her business three years ago and has learnt business skills from one of her neighbors. Currently, she has a lot more customers than ever before. To expand her business as well as to increase her profit, Mrs. Yung S. needs more capital to buy a large quantity of garlic to meet the growing customer demands.

loans.use: To buy in a large quantity of garlic to fulfill her client demands.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Mrs. Kan E. is a villager in Trapaing Sla Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer and pig breeder. Since the second business is going well, she wants to expand it.Mrs. E. is requesting a loan to buy five more piglets and to buy pig food for her pigs. 

Mrs. Kan E. is a 56-year-old widow with a child who is a government officer. Mrs. Kan E. hopes to increase her income after she sells her pigs.

loans.use: To buy five more piglets and pig food.

loans.name: Zuhura W.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 35-year-old Zuhura W. K. from Tukuyu. She is married with two children between the ages of 11 and 14 and is also responsible for supporting two dependents because their parents passed away. Zuhura has been operating a shop since 2005, selling vitenge (see below), bedsheets, sweaters, blankets, and gowns. Assisted by her younger sister, she works 10 hours each day, 7 days per week, currently earning about $85 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 in order to buy new clothing to sell, and in the future plans to have a big shop for garments. Zuhura thanks you for your support!

Traditional clothing worn by Tanzanian women is called kanga and vitenge. The kanga is a piece of printed cotton fabric often with a border along all four sides. It is printed using the silkscreen method with its pattern in frames. Kitenge (the Swahili plural is vitenge) is a cotton fabric with wax print, printed by using rotary printing machines. Kitenge is a communicating textile - the various colors, patterns, writings and symbols represent moods, feelings, cultures, and traditions of native African people.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.en: Gulsara has been selling children's clothing for many years. She began her business with less than $100. Gulsara has grown her business substantially and now has her own area in the market where she sells her items everyday. She would like to borrow money to expand her business even more.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing for sale.

loans.name: Chon

texts.en: Chon L., 37, is married and has four children. The family lives in Kampong Chhnang, Cambodia. Although Chon L. is the village chief, he makes less than one dollar per day. On the other hand, his wife, who works as a land dealer, makes around US$10 per day. The couple also raises animals and grows rice to earn extra income. All of their children are students. Chon L. currently needs a loan of US$1,000 to be able to purchase more land to grow rice. He thereby hopes to increase his income and his family's standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase of land to grow rice

loans.name: Rahimjon

texts.ru: Лутфиев Рахимджон проживает в городе Курган-тюбе. Возраст 22 года, женат и имеет двоих детей. Занимается торговлей. Имеет торговую точку , которую арендует у своих родственников. Занимается бизнесом уже три года. Привозит товар из города Душанбе, покупая в оптовых  магазинах . Планирует получить кредит для покупки товара. Этим она увеличит товарооборот . Погасить кредит планирует в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rahimjon L. lives in the city of Kurgan-Tube. He is 22 years old, married and has two children. For the last three years Rahimjon has been managing a shop which he rents from his relatives. He drives in goods from Dushanbe where he can purchase them cheaply from wholesale stores. In order to expand the store's inventory Rahimjon needs to purchase another large batch of goods and he plans to finance the purchase by taking out this loan. He wants to pay back the loan in the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of goods

loans.name: Fatma's Group

texts.en: Earlier this year, Fatma began making and selling bricks in Zanzibar.  She is now seeking her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to help her get her business off the ground.  She is married and has three children, ages 5, 4, and one-and-a-half.  She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Tatu, Fatma, Hasina, Niazao, and Riaiki.

loans.use: To buy more material to make bricks for her business

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Mrs. Im H., 54, has a grocery sales business which she runs from her home. She also helps provide food to the people in her community. Mrs. Im H. started her business in 2004, and by now it has become profitable. As a result of her business activities, she typically makes around US$10 per day. 
To meet the growing customer demand, however, Mrs. Im H. would like to request a loan of US$700 to be able to expand her grocery inventory by adding more products.

loans.use: Purchase of products for a grocery store

loans.name: Emelia J.

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 55-year-old Emelia J. M. from Tukuyu. She is married with six children between the ages of 18 and 35 and is also responsible for supporting two dependents because they are street children. Emelia, assisted by her husband, has been running a fish-selling business since 2006, working 10 hours per day, 7 days per week.

Currently earning about $35 a month from her business, she is requesting a loan of $250 to increase her bulk purchases of fish in order to realize more profit. In the future, Emelia plans to expand the business. She thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To increase her bulk purchases of fish.

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg is married and lives with his wife in Ivano-Frankivsk. He offers transportation services as a taxi driver in his home town. He has been in this business for four years. Oleg's enterprise has benefited a lot from Nadiya Ukraine financial assistance. Presently, he is making about $40-50 of income each day.

Oleg has recently purchased a newer vehicle which runs more smoothly and helps him serve his customers better. Oleg is requesting a 5000 Grivna loan, $975, to pay for his license and insurance. He intends to meet all government requirements and ensure the safety of his clients. Oleg admits that he is very happy to be self-employed. He used to work as a truck driver for a local company, however the taxi business suits him and his lifestyle a lot better. Oleg is hoping to use a portion of his profits to pay for his wife's university fees as she is a student getting a higher education in one of the local universities.

loans.use: pay for license and insurance

loans.name: Ur

texts.en:
Mrs. Ur S. was born in 1965 and lives in Suong Keit Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She owns a small restaurant where she sells food to villagers and tourists. Mrs. Ur S. is a 43-year-old widow with three children, one of whom repairs cars, while the remaining two are attending the local school. The repair business has a problem because of insufficient car parts in inventory.

Mrs. Ur S. decided to ask for a loan to buy car parts for her child who is in the car repair business.

loans.use: To buy car parts for a car repair business.

loans.name: Mak

texts.en: Mak N., 46, is married and lives with her eight children in the Prey Veng province. She and her husband work as vendors selling fruit and typically make about US$5 per day. They are also supported by four of their children who work in a garment factory. Selling fruit has been a difficult business, mostly due to weather conditions that have not been conducive to a good growing season. Therefore, Mak is asking for a loan of US$1,200 to purchase more fruit for sale. She is confident that this loan will help increase her daily income and allow her to better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits for sale.

loans.name: Chab

texts.en:
Mrs. Chab M., 26, is married with little four children and works as vendor selling fish in her community, making about US$ 5/day in profit. Her husband is a carpenter and in the rainy season he also works as a fisherman, earning $2.50/day.

Chab M. has lately applied for a loan to purchase cows to breed and sell for additional income; the remainder of the loan she will use to expand her business. ( Her husband is pictured because Mrs. Chab M. is not available)

loans.use: To expand her business and buy cows to breed for additional income

loans.name: In

texts.en:
Mrs. In C. is a villager in Suong Keit Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband, Mr. Sieb Tom, are farmers. They have a problem with their fields because their soil is not fertile. To deal with this problem, Mrs. In C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to make the crop more productive.

She is 35-years-old and the mother four children. One child is a fisherman while another paints cars. The second youngest child is attending the local school while the youngest, age five, stays at home. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the soil and increase crop production.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng P., 47, is a professional tailor, making US$2.5 per day. She lives in the Kampong Cham province together with one of her five children. Seng is also being supported by one of her sons who works as a mender. Seng P. would like to take out a loan of US$1,000 to set up a hair-dressing shop and a grocery store for her children. The loan would allow Seng and her children to increase their daily income.

loans.use: To set up a hair dressing shop and grocery store for her children.

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is married to Nadiya and has a 9-year-old son. He lives in Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine, and offers technical maintenance services at a gas station in his home town. Andrei decided to launch this business because he has always loved working with technical systems. He's been running this business for 6 years. Currently, his daily income is about $100. He has just bought a car for his family to make their life more comfortable.

Andrei is seeking a 3000 Grivna loan that he is hoping to invest in the purchase of vehicle oil. He believes his business policy, that allows deferred payments, will be an attraction for his customers and will help him stand out among his competitors. Andrei has successfully repaid 3 loans to Nadiya Ukraine which has impacted the growth of his business.

Note: this is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in 2 months.

loans.use: To purchase 300 liters of motor oil

loans.name: Mong

texts.en:
Mrs. Mong I. was born in 1957 and lives in Trapaning Chork Village in the Kampong Cham Province. She owns 1.5 hectares of land which she uses to cultivate rice to sell. She now faces a small problem because her soil is infertile. To solve this problem, Mrs. Mong I. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to improve her crop output. Her husband, Mr. Thun Thorn, helps his wife.

Mrs. Mong I. is the mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a coal kiln where they make a small income to help support the family. The remaining one is enrolled in the local school. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to improve the soil for rice cultivation.

loans.name: Chem

texts.en: Chem M., 34, is married and lives with her husband and their three school-aged children in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 1992, she has been engaged in the business of selling fermented fish and palm sugar to earn a living. On average, Chem M. is able to make about US$2.5 per day. Her husband, working as a taxi-driver, also makes approximately US$2.5 per day. At present, Chem M. would like to take out a loan of US$800 to purchase a motorbike and a trailer to transport the fermented fish and palm sugar.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike and a trailer for business

loans.name: Kuy

texts.en: Kuy T., 34, is a farmer and lives about 124 miles from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Her husband works as a motor-taxi driver and makes US$3 per day. The couple has two young children. Kuy typically makes less than US$1 per day, because planting rice is difficult due to bad weather conditions. She uses a lot of labor, but earns too little to support her family. Kuy also faces problems related to water supply, and even during the rainy season there is sometimes not enough water for plantation. Inflation is among the main factors contributing to the low profits from farming in the area, since the prices of fertilizers and rice seeds have skyrocketed. Most of the farmers therefore produce less output. Kuy is currently asking for a loan of US$500 to be able to purchase a motorbike for her husband's motor-taxi business.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike for a motor-taxi business

loans.name: Mrs. Bal Voeun Group

texts.en:
This group of five who live in Cheach Cheung Village in the Kampong Cham Province has formed a group loan and Mrs. Bal V. is the group leader who has been selected by the members. She and her husband, Mr. Vin Tha, are vegetable farmers. They face an obstacle because their soil is infertile. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Bal V. decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizers to support her field. Mrs. Bal V. is 43-years-old and the mother of a child who is 23-years-old and a farmer.

This group loan has end-of-term loans so all the members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to support the soil.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao N., 27, is married and lives with her husband and child in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Mao N.'s husband sells fruit and makes around US$5 per day. Mao N. makes a living as a farmer, but her income is currently endangered by the high rice seed and fertilizer prices and the bad weather conditions. Mao N. grows rice twice a year: during the dry season which lasts about 3-4 months, and then during the rainy season which is 6-7 months long. She would now like to take out a loan of US$1,000 to increase the fruit sales, as well as to be able to repair her house.

loans.use: Purchase of fruit for sale and repair of a house

loans.name: Mrs. So Teur Group

texts.en:
Mr. So T. is the group leader of four who all live in Cheach Cheung Village in the Kampong Cham Province. The group members will use the loan for different purposes. Mr. So T. is a vegetable farmer who grows potatoes so he is requesting a loan to buy more potato tubers to increase his crop production. His wife, Mrs. Seng Thorn, helps him on the plantation. The couple has five children, all of whom are attending the local school.

This group loan has end-of-term loans so all the members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more potato tubers to increase crop production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in beauty products and other materials for her salon.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: FATOU G. COMMERCIALISE DES PRODUITS LOCAUX (ARACHIDE,MIL,MAIS,NIEBE ETC.....)DEPUIS 10 ANS.ELLE EST MARIE, ET HABITE AU QUARTIER CHAMP DE COURSE A DIOURBEL.
texts.en:
FATOU G. has been marketing local produce (peanuts, millet, corn, black eye peas, etc...) for ten years. She is married and lives in the CHAMP DE COURSE district in DIOURBEL.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell local produce

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her small business

loans.name: Uth

texts.en: Uth Y., 48, is married and has three children. The family lives in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. Uth earns income growing rice and raising pigs, and typically makes US$2.5 per day. Her husband has an ice-cream sales business, and he also makes about US$2.5 per day. Uth Y. would like a loan of US$300 to be able to purchase feed for pigs as well as additional pigs for breeding.

loans.use: Purchase of pigs and feed for pigs

loans.name: Yok

texts.en:
Mrs. Yok S., 28, is a farmer in Kosh Nhaer Village in the Takeo Province. Her husband, Mr. Soy Set, is a construction worker who makes a small income to help support his family. She is the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

Although Mrs. Yok S. and her husband have income from different businesses, they still live in poor conditions. To improve their living standards, she decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings and purchase timbers to build a new house for her family. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To add to savings and purchase timbers to build a new house for the family.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang C., 45, is married and works as a fortune-teller in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. On average, she makes about US$5 per day, while her husband, working as a farmer, makes less than one dollar per day. The couple has six children, two of whom are married and no longer live with their parents. The other four children are still students. At present, Neang C. would like to take out a loan of US$700 to be able to grow more beans and to purchase additional farmland.

loans.use: Purchase of land for farming beans

loans.name: Lukia Ssekaana's Group

texts.en:
Lukia is the leader of 5 members of a group. She is a 38-year-old married woman with 3 children, aged between 18 and 7. All her children go to school. She resides in and owns a 6-room house, where she is staying with 5 people. Lukia also takes care of her sister's son. There is electricity but no piped water at her home. The family gets 4 meals a day.

Lukia resides and works in a semi-urban area that is on the outskirts of Kampala. Lukia deals in secondhand clothes and operates from her home. She uses public transport from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala city. Lukia sells to an average of 10 people a day and works 6 days a week. Lukia sells to all categories of people, mainly on a retail basis. Lukia's major monthly expenses include food, school fees, and electricity. Lukia has been in this business for over 10 years. Lukia has been with MCDT for 10 years and is servicing her sixth loan. Lukia is aspiring to see her business grow bigger so that she can start selling wholesale. .

loans.use: To invest in her business

loans.name: Bilaly

texts.fr: BILALY C. EST UN PHOTOGRAHE QUI HABITE AU QUARTIER NDAYANNE A DIOURBEL. IL A UNE EXPERIENCE DE 10 ANS DANS LE SECTEUR. IL EST MARIE
texts.en:
BILALY C. is a photographer who lives in the NDAYANNE district in DIOURBEL. He has ten years of experience in the sector. He is married.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: EQUIPMENT

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Mrs. Suon N., 31, is a farmer in Trapaing Krasang Village in the Takeo Province. She owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Bu Pros, is a construction worker who makes a small income to help support his family. The couple has three children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest one is too young to work.

Although Mrs. Suon N. and her husband try to work hard, the family still lives in poor conditions. To improve these conditions, Mrs. Suon N. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase her income after she sells the cow. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Pat

texts.en: Pat N., 47, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham province with her four children. Working in the recycling business together with her husband, Pat N. typically makes around US$2 per day. Pat N. sees room for expansion for her current business, and she has approached CREDIT to receive a loan of US$350 to purchase more recyclable items to resell at the recycling plant. Pat N. sees this loan as a good investment in her business as well as a way to increase her family's income. She is very confident that the business venture will be successful, and that her family will be able to raise its standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase of recyclable items for re-sale

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch N. was born in 1949 and lives in Kosh Nhai Village in the Takeo Province. She is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it by requesting a loan to buy four more piglets for breeding and to purchase more food to feed her pigs.

Mrs. Touch N. has two children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory and the other is laborer.

loans.use: To buy four more piglets for breeding and to purchase more food to feed pigs.

loans.name: Lamine

texts.fr: LAMINE D. HABITE AU QUARTIER CHAMP DE COURSE A DIOURBEL. SON ACTIVITE CONSISTE A ACHETER DES MOUTONS, LES ENGRAISSER ET LES REVENDRE. IL A UNE EXPERIENCE DE 5 ANS.
texts.en:
LAMINE D. lives in the CHAMP DE COURSE district of DIOURBEL. His work involves buying sheep, fattening them, and selling them. He has five years of experience.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fattening sheep

loans.name: Phaer

texts.en:
Mrs. Phaer P. is a villager in Ta Skaom Village in the Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Suos Soeur, are farmers. They have four children, three of whom are attending the local school while the other one is too young to work

Mrs. Phaer P. and her husband cannot both support their family and improve their living conditions without a loan. In order to improve their housing situation, Mrs. Phaer P. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to be able to buy timber and build a new house for her family. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To combine savings with a loan and buy timber to build a new house for the family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in various goods to operate a small business.

loans.name: Phy

texts.en:
Mrs. Phy M., 31, is a farmer in Ta Skaom Village in the Takeo Province. Her husband, Mr. Lach Man, is a construction worker who makes a small income. Although Mrs. Phy M. and her husband have income from different businesses, they still live in poor conditions and in an old house.

In order to improve her living conditions, Mrs. Phy M. decided to ask for a loan to buy timbers to build a new house for her family. The couple has four children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school while the remaining two stay at home to help their parents. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy timbers to build a new house for the family.

loans.name: Astou

texts.fr: ASTOU D. HABITE AU QUARTIER NDAYANNE DE DIOURBEL. ELLE EVOLUE DANS LE SECTEUR DU COMMERCE DEPUIS 08 ANS. SON ACTIVIT2 CONSISTE A VENTRE DES CEREALES.
texts.en:
ASTOU D. lives in the NDAYANNE district of DIOURBEL. She has been developing in the commerce sector for eight years. Her work involves selling grain.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell grain

loans.name: Nget

texts.en:
Mrs. Nget H. was born in 1970 and lives in Ta Skaom Village in the Takeo Province. She is a farmer and her husband, Mr. Un Voeurn, is a construction worker. They have six children, three of whom are construction workers while two are attending the local school. The youngest one is too young to work or study.

Although Mrs. Nget H.'s family members have income, they still live in an old house and in poor conditions. In order to improve their living standard, Mrs. Nget H. has decided to ask for a loan to buy timbers to build a new house for her family. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy timbers to build a new family house.

loans.name: Jessica Nakanwagi's Group

texts.en:
Jessica is the leader of 4 members of a group. She is a 43-year-old married woman with 4 children, aged between 28 and 8. Two of her children go to school. Her first 2 children are married and are not working. She resides in and owns a 3-room house, where she is staying with 3 people and doesn't take care of any other additional family members. There is electricity and piped water at her home. The family gets 2 meals a day.

She resides and works in a semi-urban area that is on the outskirts of Kampala. Jessica runs a charcoal store at her home in Nakulabye market, near Kampala city. Jessica doesn't incur any extra transport costs because she gets the charcoal from suppliers, who get it from villages. Jessica sells to an average of 15 people a day and works 7 days a week. Jessica sells to all categories of people, and her major monthly expense is medication. Jessica has been with MCDT for 4 years and is servicing her eighth loan. Jessica is aspiring to see her business grow bigger so that she can start selling both retail and wholesale. She wants to boost her business and construct rental shops in the available space.

loans.use: To boost her business

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 39-year-old Rukia K. from Mbeya. She is married with five children between the ages of 7 and 20, and is also responsible for supporting one dependent because he is schooling in the area. Rukia has been operating a grocery store since 2000 selling goods such as rice, cooking oil, and soda. Assisted by her husband, she works 14 hours per day, 7 days per week, earning about $200 each month from her business.

Rukia is requesting a loan of $400 in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, cooking oil, and soda. In the future, she plans to open another business and increase the quantity and range of her stock. Rukia thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of rice, cooking oil, and soda.

loans.name: Gnouma

texts.fr: GNOUMA T. HABITE LE QUARTIER NDAYANE DE DIOURBEL. ELLE EVOLUE DANS LE SECTEUR DE LA TEINTURE DEPUIS 10ANS. ELLE EST MARIEE.
texts.en:
Gnouma T. lives in the Ndayane neighborhood of Diourbel. She has been working at dyeing fabric for 10 years. She is married.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of materials necessary for dyeing fabric

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Sesilia D. from Mbeya, married with two children between the ages of 9 and 13. Sesilia has been running a grocery and crops business since 2007. After purchasing commodities such as rice, cooking oil, and soda wholesale from regional farmers, she retails them to people in the area. Assisted by one employee and her brother, Sesilia currently earns about $200 per month working 12 hours each day, 6 days per week.

She is requesting a loan of $650 to purchase additional crops and commodities such as cooking oil, sugar, soap and salt for her grocery store. In the future, she plans to open another business. Sesilia thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional crops and commodities for her grocery store.

loans.name: Annette Nakiryowa's Group

texts.en:
Annette is the leader of a group of 5 members. She is 45 years old, divorced, with 2 children aged 17 and 15 years who go to school. She resides in and owns a two-roomed house where she is staying with three people and takes care of three orphans. She gets some financial assistance from her former husband to look after the children. They have electricity and piped water at home. The family gets three meals a day.

She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. Annette runs a hotel in Kibuye, one of the city suburbs, and incurs some transport costs for transportation of food for her customers' convenience. Her major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises (at 50000 per month), water and electricity bills. Annette receives an average of 50 customers daily. She has been with MCDT for 6 years and is servicing her twelfth loan. Besides running a small eating joint she also sells bananas on her veranda. She wants to use this loan to increase stock in her business.

loans.use: To increase stock in her business

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: COUMBA L. HABITE AU QUARTIER NDAYANE DE DIOURBEL. ELLE COMMERCIALISE DES DENREES ALIMENTAIRES DEPUIS 2003. ELLE EST MARIEE.
texts.en:
COUMBA L. lives in the NDAYANE district of DIOURBEL. She has been marketing grocery items since 2003. She is married.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell groceries

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally S. is 28 years old, and she is a farmer who lives in Orsvay Commune, Kampong Cham Province. She is married to Mr. Kong Hoeun, and she has two children. Notably, her husband is also a farmer. In fact, Phally has been farming with her husband since 2000, and they typically generate a combined income of US$3.00 per day.

For another source of income, Phally is seeking a loan in the amount of US$1,100 to purchase oxen to breed and to then resell for a profit. As for her future plan, she wants to run a business of exporting oxen to other country.

loans.use: To purchase oxen for breeding purposes and to resell them for profit

loans.name: Resty Kayondo's Group

texts.en:
Resty is the leader of 5 members of a group. She is a 45-year-old divorced woman with 1 daughter, age 30 years. She resides in and owns a 3-room house, where she is staying with 4 people. Resty takes care of her mother. There is electricity and piped water at her home.

The family gets 3 meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area that is on the outskirts of Kampala. Resty sells newspapers and operates a public pay phone in Bwaise, one of the city suburbs. She sells to an average of 50 people a day and works 6 days a week. Resty's major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises and medication. Resty bicycles to and from work. She has been in this business for 10 years.

Resty's main challenges include the rainy season, which disturbs her a lot, and overcomes it by using umbrellas. Resty has been with MCDT for over 5 years and is servicing her eighth loan, working all this long time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to increase stock in her business and acquire more telephone booths. .

loans.use: To increase stock and buy another telephone booth

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr: OUMAR B. EST UN ELEVEUR DE MOUTONS DEPUIS 1998. SON ACTIVITE CONSISTE A ENGRAISSER DES MOUTONS ET LES REVENDRE.
texts.en:
Oumar B. has been a sheep raiser since 1998. His business consists in fattening sheep and re-selling them.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sheep fattening

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: COUMBA D. HABITE AU QUARTIER NDAYANE DE DIOURBEL. ELLE COMMERCIALISE DU MIL,NIEBE,ARACHIDE ETC..... DEPUIS +20 ANS. ELLE EST MARIEE
texts.en:
COUMBA D. liives in the NDAYANE district of DIOURBEL. She has been marketing millet, niebe (black eye peas), peanuts, etc. for over twenty years. She is married.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell local grains

loans.name: Mame Diarra

texts.fr: MAME DIARRA S. COMMERCIALISE DES CEREALES TELS QUE MIL, ARACHIDE, NIEBE, ET HABITE AU QUARTIER NDAYANE DE DIOURBEL. ELLE EST DANS CE SECTEUR DEPUIS 5 ANS.
texts.en:
Mame Diarra S. sells grains including millet, peanuts and cowpeas. She lives in the Ndayane district of Diourbel. She has been in this line of business for five years.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy and sell grain

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha S. is 52 years old, widowed, and grows vegetables and flowers to sell in Chreybak Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Chantha can earn around US$ 7.50 per day from her business. She cares for three children, all of whom still live at home. One is a secondary school who can earn US$100 per month, another one is a receptionist who earns US$100 per month and thier income partly support to family.

Chantha needs a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase a motorcycle and trailer to transport her vegetables and flowers to sell in the market. Also she wants her one son to drive a taxi after her work hours. The loans will allow her to improve business activities and increase the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle and trailer to transport her vegetables and flowers to sell in the market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a nail art printer, nail polish, and acrylic and gel nails

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fashionable jewelry to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Mareme

texts.fr: MAREME N. HABITE AU QUARTIER CHAMP DE COURSES DE DIOURBEL ET EVOLUE DANS LE SECTEUR DU COMMERCE D'HABILLEMENT DEPUIS 2 ANS. ELLE EST MARIEE ET A 3 ENFANTS A CHARGE.
texts.en:
Mareme N. lives in the Champ de Courses district of Diourbel and has been selling clothing for 2 years. She is married and raising 3 children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Cette dame tient un commerce de produits locaux (pâte d'arachide, huille de palme etc). Avec cette activité elle soutient son mari pour entretenir leur famille de 5 enfants; Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer ses activités
texts.en:
This lady sells local products (peanut butter, palm oil, etc.). With this business she helps her husband support their family of 5 children. She is requesting this loan to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to bolster her little business

loans.name: Diab

texts.fr: DIAB F. EVOLUE DANS LE SECTEUR DE L'ELEVAGE DEPUIS 2001. SON ACTIVITE CONSISTE A ACHETER DES CHEVRES, LES ENGRAISSE ET LES REVENDE DANS LE MARCHE.
texts.en:
DIAB F. has been progressing in the livestock sector since 2001. His work consists of buying goats, fattening them, and reselling them at market.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fattening sheep and goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase footwear and toys to sell in her small business.

loans.name: Ifan Nafa Group

texts.fr: Ce groupement mixte s'investit dans le transport fluvial entre Ziguinchor et sédhiou; ils sollicitent un prêt pour acheter suffisament du carburant. Avec leurs activités les membres de IFAN NAFA arrivent à satisfaire leurs besoins sociaux
texts.en:
This mixed group works in river transport between Ziguinchor and Sédhiou. They are asking for a loan to buy needed fuel. With their businesses the members of IFAN NAFA manage to satisfy their needs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: river transport

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase clothing for her small business.

loans.name: Walde

texts.fr: Mm D. est une femme teinturiére  .Elle exerce ce metier depuis longtemps  dans cadre de son entreprise familiale.le boubou teinté est tres demendé au sénégal surtout à l 'occasion des fetes Le pret sollicité lui permetra de renforcer ses activités de production  .
texts.en:
Mrs. D. specializes in dyeing cloth. She has been doing this work for a long time as a family business. Hand-dyed boubous (flowing robes worn by men and women) are very much in demand in Senegal, especially around the holidays. The requested loan will allow her to increase her production of hand-dyed cloth.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Aida

texts.fr: AIDA S. est une femme restauratrice mariée .Elle gére un restaurant dans un des quartiers de mbour depuis plusieurs années.Son activité marche bien ,la demande  est tres forte .Pour satisfére cette demande et moderniser le restaurant elle sollicite un pret.
texts.en:
Aida S. is married and is in the food service business. She has managed a little restaurant in a neighborhood in Mbour for several years. Her business is going well, with lots of customers. She is asking for a loan to satisfy her customer demand and modernize her restaurant.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Ibrahima  B. est un pere de famille. Il a comme  activité le commerce de detail  qu'il exerce dans un quartier appelé Grand Mbour. Il a une bonne experience  de cinq ans dans le domaine du commerce de Détail.  Avec le pret ibrahima envisage d'augmenter ses stocks de marchandises pour accroitre son chiffre d' affaire et améliorer ainsi sa condition de vie et celle de sa petite famille. iL est trés dynamique et est membre de l'IMCEC depuis quelques mois.
texts.en:
Commerce is an activity that occupies a good number of Senegalese. Ibrahima for one retails foodstuffs, i.e. has a general store, in Senegal. Shops like hers are found in all the neighborhoods of Mbour. With her loan, Ibrahima wants to expand her inventory so as to increase her turnover.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario, de 37 años, tiene 3 hijos que están cursando estudios secundarios, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras regionales desde el primer momento en que se vino a vivir en su asentamiento humano, le va muy bien, ya que es la única que vende este producto. Tiene también a su esposo Javier, quien siempre lo apoya en todo y  está de acuerdo con lo que se propone. Ahora tiene el deseo de seguir creciendo en su negocio, y posteriormente alquilar un local o mandar a construir un kiosco para la venta de sus productos, pero para esto ella estima de un capital para poder lograr lo que realmente quiere. Con tu ayuda esta madre saldrá adelante en poco tiempo.
texts.en:
Rosario is 37 years old and has three children in high school. She makes a living selling regional vegetables since the first moment she came to this settlement, and it has gone very well since she is the only one who sells these products. Her husband, Javier, always supports and agrees with her goals. Currently, Rosario hopes to keep growing her business and later rent a storefront or pay for a kiosk to be built for her to sell her products. But she needs more capital to really achieve what she wants. With your help this mother will make headway in no time.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of regional vegetables she sells

loans.name: Janina

texts.es: Janina, de 23 años, tiene a su hija de dos añitos, de nombre Pamela, desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a la venta de golosinas, su esposo Delmer la apoya  en todas sus aspiraciones, él trabaja como pintor de carros. Adicionalmente, Janina vende productos de belleza de una línea cosmética muy reconocida a nivel nacional, todo esto lo hace por su hija a quien la ama mucho y solo espera que no le falte nada, que pase lo que pase en el futuro, ella la seguirá apoyando. Janina quiere incrementar su venta de golosinas y construir posteriormente su bodega, tiene muchas ideas de negocio, y para eso necesariamente estima de un capital que levantará sus ganas de seguir adelante. Apoyemos a esta joven madre que con esfuerzo y ahínco sigue dándole duro al trabajo, solo por prosperar, ella no te defraudara.
texts.en:
Janina is 23 years old and has a two-year-old daughter, Pamela. For a long time she has made a living selling snacks. Her husband, Delmer, supports her in all her goals. He paints cars for a living. Along with her snack business, Janina also sells beauty products from a cosmetic line well known in her country. She does all this for her little daughter, whom she loves very much and hopes she never lacks anything. May whatever happen in the future happen, but she will always support her daughter. Janina wants to increase her snack sales and later build a convenience store. She has many business ideas, and to carry them out she's requesting a loan to help her increase her earnings and make headway. Let's support this young mother who works with effort and zeal so she and her family can prosper. She will not let you down.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase number of snacks she sells and also purchase more beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel tiene 23 años y es madre soltera, tiene a su pequeña de un añito de edad, quien es su inspiración de seguir adelante. Se dedica a la venta de ropa, la que deja al crédito y al contado, así como también la lleva a vender por los diferentes caseríos de la región.  Adicionalmente, por las mañanas vende jugo de frutas, y también se dedica al arte textil, Isabel se considera muy trabajadora, y quiere seguir creciendo en este negocio y tener su local propio para la  venta de ropa. Necesita de un préstamo para lograr su máximo deseo.
texts.en:
Isabel is 23 years old and a single mother. Her young daughter is one year old and her inspiration for getting ahead. She works selling clothing on credit and for cash and takes it to sell in different communities in the region. Also, in the mornings she sells fruit juice and also makes textile handicrafts. Isabel is considered a very hard worker and she wants to continue growing the business and to have her own locale where she can sell clothing. She needs a loan to accomplish her greatest desire.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a locale to be used for clothing sales

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga a sus 26 años tiene a su pequeño de 2 años, quien significa todo para ella. Su esposo Percy la apoya mucho y está de acuerdo con sus decisiones. Ella se dedica a la venta de gelatinas, helados de hielo y chupetes, pertenece a un banco comunal y gracias al apoyo brindado sigue adelante en su negocio, pero eso no es todo, quiere mandar a construir un kiosco para la venta de sus productos y complementarlo con otros productos. Para lograr su objetivo ella estima de un préstamo. Ayuda a esta madre a cumplir con su propósito, ella no te defraudara.
texts.en:
Olga, 26, has a 2-year-old who means everything to her. Her husband Percy helps her a lot and supports her decisions. She sells gelatins, ice creams and lolly pops. She belongs to a communal bank, and thanks to the help provided she is getting ahead in her business. But this is not all: she wants to have a kiosk built for the sale of her products, including additional items. She is considering this loan in order to achieve her objective. Help this mother to accomplish her goal, she will not disappoint you.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To enlarge her business with the construction of a kiosk to sell her products

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin tiene 48 años, es padre de 2 hijos, los cuales estudian y lo quieren mucho, su esposa Giovanna se dedica a al venta de ropa, lo apoya mucho y está de acuerdo con lo que siempre él  se propone. Es un hombre trabajador que se dedica a fondo al transporte de pasajeros desde hace mucho tiempo, es propietario de tres motocarros, uno de ellos, lo maneja él mismo, y contrata a dos personas para conducir los otros dos, brindando trabajo de esa forma. Lo más importante es hacer estudiar a sus hijos, para que los mismos, en un mañana sean profesionales.  Edwin quiere seguir creciendo en esto del transporte, para ello debe que tener en buenas condiciones sus herramientas de trabajo, es por eso que quiere comprar repuestos para mejorarlos, por lo que solicita este préstamo.  Gracias a este trabajo reguló su nivel de vida, por ello, posteriormente quiere comprarse otro motocarro.
texts.en:
Edwin is 48 years old and he is the father of 2 children, they are currently going to school and they love him very much. His wife Giovanna sells clothing and she supports him in everything he does. He is a hard working person and he has been providing transportation for passengers for a long time now. He is the owner of 3 motorcycles, one that he drives himself, leaving the other two to be driven by hired help. He is proud to provide work in this manner. The most important to him is that his children keep going to school, so that they will have a better tomorrow, to be professionals. Edwin wishes to keep his transportation business growing, and for this he needs to have his working tools in good working order. He needs to buy spare parts to improve their condition and that is why he is requesting a loan. Thanks to this work he has been able to stabilize his quality of life. He wishes to purchase another motorcycle.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his motorcycles.

loans.name: Keti

texts.es: Keti a sus 40 años de edad es madre de 4 hijos que están estudiando, a los cuales tiene que apoyar hasta que sean profesionales. Mujer decidida y trabajadora, es dueña de un motocarro, el mismo que lo maneja su esposo Segundo, quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros por los diferentes lugares de su  zona. Aparte de administrar las ganancias del motocarro, vende ropa por los distintos lugares de su localidad, estas actividades las realiza con el fin de que junto a su esposo, sostengan la economía familiar.  Es por eso que quiere comprar repuestos para mandar a reparar su motocarro, para realizar su deseo necesita de un capital lo más pronto posible. Ayuda a esta madre que muestra su interés por salir adelante.
texts.en:
Keti, 40, is the mother of 4 children of school age, who she wants to support so they can become professionals. A decisive and hard-working woman, she is the owner of a three-wheeler operated by her husband Segundo, who transports passengers around the different areas within his zone. Apart from managing the income from the three-wheeler, she sells clothing in various locations in her neighborhood. She carries out these activities so that she and her husband can support the family. This is why she wants to buy spare parts to repair her three-wheeler, for which she needs capital as soon as possible. Help this mother who is demonstrating her desire to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair her three-wheeler

loans.name: Orfa

texts.es: Orfa tiene 41 años, es madre D. 5 hijos, D. los cuales 3 ya son independientes y 2 estudian. Ella cuenta con el apoyo incondicional D. su esposo Néstor quien es pescador. Madre trabajadora que demuestra su interés por salir adelante con el arte textil, confecciona todo tipo D. prendas, para ella no existe nada imposible. Compra telas estampadas y confecciona lo último en moda, lleva a venD. al ropa por diferentes lugares, dejándola a crédito o al contado. Orfa quiere seguir creciendo en su negocio textil, así como también quiere comprarse una máquina D. coser, porque la que tiene se encuentra en mal estado, sin embargo para realizar este sueño, le hace falta un préstamo, el cual hará realidad sus deseos.
texts.en:
Orfa, 41, is the mother of 5 children, of whom 3 are already on their own, 2 in school. She depends on the unconditional support of her husband Nestor, who is a fisherman. A hard-working mother who demonstrates her desire to get ahead in textile art, she creates all sorts of garments, nothing is impossible to her. She buys printed fabrics and creates up-to-the-minute fashions. She takes the clothing to different places to be sold, either for cash or leaving it on credit. Orfa wants to keep growing her textile business, so she wants to purchase a sewing machine, because the one she has now is in poor condition. Nevertheless, to realize her dream, she needs a loan with which to make her wishes a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine in order to continue creating articles of clothing

loans.name: Azucena

texts.es: Azucena es una joven madre de 24 años, tiene su propia cevicheria de nombre “La Perla”, la mismo que es muy concurrida por su buena sazón y atención, inició este negocio debido a la separación de su pareja,  circunstancia que la motivó a buscar una superación personal, ahora esta muy contenta, porque gracias al apoyo de un banco comunal, al cual pertenece, está saliendo adelante. Azucena, mediante su negocio, quiere sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos, que significan mucho para ella, sobre todo sus ganas de seguir adelante. Para ampliar su negocio, necesita de la cantidad que solicita. Apoya a esta madre que lucha por seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Azucena is a young mother, aged 24 yeas, and she owns her own restaurant called "La Perla". It is a highly visited locale because of the good food and good customer service. She started this business because she separated from her partner, a situation that motivated her to seek out a way of improving herself. She is very happy now because thanks to the support from the community bank, the one where she is member, she is seeing success. Azucena is the manager of her business and she wants to provide for her 2 children, they who mean the world to her and they who are the reason to keep going. To expand her business she requires the loan that she is requesting. Support this young Mom that is working so hard to keep going.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand and improve her restaurant.

loans.name: Iris

texts.es: Iris, en  la actualidad tiene 25 años, es madre de una hija de 6 años, que ha empezado sus estudios y es su aspiración de seguir  luchando en su negocio. Su pareja Joe, siempre la apoya en lo posible, y está de acuerdo con sus propósitos. Iris se dedica a la venta de ropa y a la exportación, al por mayor, de medias solo para  niñas, es una  joven madre que desde muy temprana edad se inició en el comercio, es por eso que en la actualidad cuenta con una gran clientela, gracias a su buena atención y forma de convencer para que lo compren sus productos. Además de querer seguir surgiendo en su negocio con el alquiler de un local para este, quiere mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda, sin embargo, no cuenta con lo suficiente para lograr lo que desea, es por eso que estima de un capital para poder cumplir con su objetivo. Ayuda esta joven madre que demuestra su interés de seguir  adelante.
texts.en:
Iris, now 25, is the mother of a 6-year-old daughter who has started school and who is her inspiration to keep struggling to increase her business. Her partner, Joe, always supports her as much as possible, and agrees with her proposals. Iris sells clothing and exports girl's stockings wholesale. She is a young mother who started in business very young, which is why she now has a large clientele, thanks to her good service and her ability to sell her products. In addition to desiring to keep her business growing by renting shop space, she also wants to improve the substructure of her home. Nevertheless, she does not have enough to accomplish her desires, which is why she wants a loan in order to achieve her objective. Help this young mother who shows such interest to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To rent shop space to sell clothing, as well as to increase her merchandise

loans.name: Milagritos

texts.es: Milagritos, de 33 años, tiene tres hijos, quienes son el significado de su vida y de seguir luchando por salir adelante, es madre soltera y esta responsabilidad, no le imposibilita seguir con su meta , es por eso que trabaja duro para sus hijos, esperando que algún día sean profesionales.  Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, desde hace ya mucho tiempo, este negocio es el que vela por el sustento económico de ella y de sus hijos, a quienes les brinda lo necesario para sus estudios. Su propósito es ampliar su negocio, comprar productos comestibles y también mejorar la estructura de su vivienda, por lo que necesariamente estima de un capital que la llevará a cumplir con su objetivo. Gracias a tu ayuda la señora Milagritos logrará su propósito en muy corto tiempo.
texts.en:
Milagritos, 33, has three children who are the meaning of her life and who keep her struggling to get ahead. She is a single mother, and this responsibility does not hinder her from keeping up with her goal. She works hard for her children, hoping that some day they will become professionals. She sells groceries and daily necessities; this business has been the economic support of herself and her children, for whom she provides everything necessary for their education. Her proposal is to increase her business, buying edible products, and also to structurally improve her home. For this she needs the capital to carry her goals to completion. Thanks to your help, Mrs. Milagritos will soon achieve her object.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the merchandise in her shop, as well as structural improvements to her house, where the shop is located.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en: Rabia is 32 years old and lives in the Northern Lebanese city of Tripoli with his parents. He works as a barber and has requested a loan of $1000 in order to redecorate his salon and purchase several new clippers and hair-cutting tools for the business. This will be Rabia's second loan. He is very grateful for the opportunity provided to him by the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new hair-cutting tools and redesign his barbershop

loans.name: Nadith

texts.es: Nadith, de 31 años, es madre de tres hijos que están estudiando, gracias a la educación y las buenas costumbres que les imparte, son muy buenos muchachos, también cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo Venancio, quien se dedica a trabajar como comerciante de forma ambulante. Ella se dedica a la venta de fruta, debido al carisma con el que cuenta y a la concurrencia de sus clientes se encuentra en la necesidad de aumentar e implementar su negocio, es por eso que necesariamente requiere de un capital para lograr su meta. Con tu apoyo la señora Nadith logrará lo que quiere en el tiempo menos pensado.
texts.en:
Nadith, 31, is the mother of 3 children of school age. Thanks to education and the good habits she has given them, they are very good boys. She also depends on the support of her husband, Venancio, who works as a traveling salesman. She sells fruit, and thanks to her charisma and the growth of her clientele, she finds herself needing to enlarge her business. This is why she needs a loan to accomplish her goal. With your help, Mrs. Nadith will achieve her desire in the shortest possible time.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To establish her fruit-selling business, building a kiosk for her sales

loans.name: Nada

texts.en: Nada is a 42-year-old woman. She is married, has 4 children and lives in Beirut, the capital of Lebanon. Nada owns a business of sewing curtains and decorative clothing using beads. Nadia has recently received a number of large orders for the upcoming winter and needs to purchase a large supply of materials. She has requested a loan of $1000 in order to fund this large purchase. Nada's first two loans have been paid back in full and on time.

loans.use: to purchase materials for sewing business

loans.name: Christian

texts.es: Christian, de 24 años, es un hombre activo, es padre de un niño de tres añitos de edad, quien es su luz y motivo para seguir adelante en lo que se propone, y de velar por su educación.  Se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace mucho tiempo, su pareja Magali se siente orgullosa de tener un hombre como él, es por eso que lo apoya en todo y siempre pide al Todopoderoso que los bendiga. Sin  embargo, Christian quiere mejorar las condiciones de su herramienta de trabajo, su motocarro, para seguir trabajando duro y sin preocupaciones, para ello necesita de un préstamo que solicita con mucha responsabilidad. Apoyemos a este joven padre, que con talento y esfuerzo trabaja arduamente por seguir surgiendo.
texts.en:
Christian is 24 years old and he is an active person, a father of a little boy aged 3 years. He is the light of his eyes and the reason to keep going in everything he does. He dreams of giving him an education. He provides transportation to passengers and he has been doing so for very long. His partner Magali feels so proud to have a husband like him, and she supports him in everything and always prays for their blessings. Nevertheless, Christian wasts to improve the condition of his work tool, his motorcycle, so that he can keep working hard without these worries. For this he is requesting a loan and he does so with a great deal of responsibility. Let us support this young father, that with a great deal of talent and hard work he keeps going arduously.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to fix the motorcycle.

loans.name: Sobhi

texts.en: Sobhi is a 51-year-old man. He lives with his wife and they have 5 children. He lives in Beirut where he owns a small garage for auto repairs. Sobhi is an ambitious man who places great emphasis on the education of his children. He has asked for a loan of $1000 in order to cover the costs of school fees for his children. This will be Sobhi's second loan.

loans.use: to help pay for his children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Salma Amory's Mapinduzi Group

texts.en:
Salma A., age 28, is single without children. She owns a pharmacy in Mbagala that she started in 2007. She works daily from 8:00 AM until 9:00 PM and earns a monthly profit of about $83.

This will be Salma's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first loan to increase the stock of her pharmacy and has since paid the loan back successfully. She intends to use this new loan for the same purpose.

Salma will share this loan with her loan group, Mapinduzi. The group has 18 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Salma is sitting second from the right in the middle row. She is wearing a black headscarf.

loans.use: To increase stock in her pharmacy

loans.name: Therese

texts.en: Therese is 24 and lives in Beirut. She owns a small beauty salon in her neighborhood and she wants to improve it by repainting her walls and installing new mirrors for her clients. She has asked for loan of $1000 for this purpose. This will be Therese's first loan.

loans.use: to redecorate Therese's beauty salon

loans.name: Habiba Selemani's Sea Cliff A Group

texts.en:
Habiba S. is 39 years old and married with two children, aged 20 and 14. Habiba owns a general store in Magomeni where she sells items such as sugar, soap, rice, and kangas (traditional Swahili cloths). She opened her store 3 years ago and works daily from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. She is able to earn a monthly profit of about $167.

This will be Habiba's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the first loan to increase the stock of her shop and has since paid the loan back successfully. She intends to use this new loan for the same purpose.

Habiba will share this loan with her subgroup, Sea Cliff A. The group has 6 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Habiba is sitting second from the left.

loans.use: To increase stock of shop.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 24-year-old Flora M. from Mbeya. She is married and has a three-year-old child. Since 2005, Flora has been buying crops from farmers and selling them in town at a higher price. She works at the business for eight hours a day, six days a week and is assisted by her husband. Flora currently earns about $120 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD to purchase additional crops such as rice, maize, and beans. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and range of the stock she sells. Flora thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase rice, maize, and beans.

loans.name: Sixta

texts.es: La señora Sixta D. habita en el barrio Laureles Sur barrio ubicado en la capital Managua, tiene la edad de 51 años, se encuentra casada con el señor Domingo Velasquez, que se desempeña como comerciante de gallinas, juntos tienen cuatros hijos de 5,10,15 y 20 años de edad, de los cuales tres de ellos estudian y el mayor trabaja. Actualmente doña Sixta se dedica a la venta de tortillas, negocio que lo tiene  ubicado en su casa, tiene 6 año de dedicarse a esta actividad, iniciándola con fondos propios, así mismo ella desea un crédito para invertirlo en su casa ya que requiere cambiar tres puertas, por tanto esta solicitando C$ 7,000 aun plazo de 7 meses y a la vez seguir trabajando con los micro créditos para seguir ampliando su negocio de tortilla, ya que de esta manera le ayudara a mejorar las condiciones de su casa y poderle apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Señora Sixta D. lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She is 51, married to Señor Domingo Velasquez, who does well as a chicken businessman. Together they have 4 children of 5, 10, 15 and 20 years of age. Three of them are in school, the eldest is working. Currently Doña Sixta sells tortillas, a business that she does from her home. She has done this for 6 years, starting with her own ovens. Now she wants credit to invest in her house, as she needs to change three doors. She is requesting a loan of $375, with a term of 9 months, during which she will continue working with the micro creditors in order to continue expanding her tortilla business. This will help her to improve the conditions of her house and to help her children in their education.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy doors for her house
